input: Hello doctor,I had mumps five months ago and after that, I started to have an infection in my left testes. It was swollen and now it has shrunk to almost half the size of the other one. As I am sexually active, I feel a pain in each of the vas deferens after sex. If I do not have sex for days, they become sensitive. I was treated with Ceftum 500 mg, the first time I had an infection. Now my question is, is there any chance that the infection is still in my body? And, do I need to get examined for it? For the time being, please suggest some precautionary antibiotics for my relief.
output: It is possible that the infection is still present in your body, and it is recommended that you get examined by a doctor to determine the cause of your symptoms. Depending on the results of the examination, your doctor may prescribe antibiotics or other medications to treat the infection. In the meantime, you can take over-the-counter pain relievers such as ibuprofen or acetaminophen to help relieve your symptoms. Additionally, you should practice safe sex and use condoms to reduce your risk of contracting a sexually transmitted infection.

input: Hello doctor,I am trying to conceive but my husband and I did cocaine a week ago. How long should my husband and I wait to safely continue to try to get pregnant? How long until it is out of our system? How long does cocaine stay in sperm? Thanks in advance.
output: Unfortunately, there is no definitive answer to this question as it depends on a variety of factors such as the amount of cocaine used, the frequency of use, and the individual's metabolism. Generally, cocaine can stay in the body for up to 72 hours, but it can remain in the system for up to a week or more. It is also important to note that cocaine can remain in sperm for up to 5 days after use. Therefore, it is best to wait at least a week before trying to conceive to ensure that the cocaine is out of your system. Additionally, it is important to speak with your doctor about any potential risks associated with using cocaine while trying to conceive.

input: Hello doctor,I am currently on the Yaz contraceptive pill. I skipped my sugar pills for around four months and had a breakthrough period this month. I had my period last week, but I still have some residual brown discharge for about a week now. Additionally, I had sex a few days ago and bled during it. Nothing hurts or is sore, I just want to know how long I am going to have the brown discharge and if I should be worried or if I should do anything about it?
output: It is normal to have some residual brown discharge after your period. This is usually caused by old blood that has been in the uterus for a while and is now being expelled. It is not usually a cause for concern. However, if the discharge is accompanied by any other symptoms such as pain, itching, or a foul odor, then you should see your doctor for further evaluation. As for the bleeding during sex, this could be caused by a number of things such as an infection or a hormonal imbalance. If it continues, you should see your doctor for further evaluation.

input: Hello doctor,My son aged 13 years has got his left eye -11 and right with -8. I am now very worried what good precautions should I take with him. Can you suggest me what should I do?
output: It is important to ensure that your son wears his glasses or contact lenses as prescribed by his eye doctor. It is also important to have regular eye exams to monitor his vision and make sure that his prescription is up to date. Additionally, it is important to ensure that your son is eating a healthy diet that is rich in vitamins and minerals, as this can help to support healthy vision. Finally, it is important to limit his exposure to screens, such as computers, phones, and televisions, as this can cause eye strain.

input: Hello doctor,I just got one side of my wisdom teeth removed both upper and lower six days ago, and I have another one scheduled after two days for the left side. The upper is 100 % fine, which they pulled. The lower they pulled the tooth without removing the root because it was too close to the nerve. I do have some stitching in this area currently on the lower cheek. Noticed a hard lump about 1 inch between my lower jawline and cheek area. Is this normal because of swelling or something else. Currently taking Amoxicillin 500 mg and Ibuprofen 600 mg. Please let me know what this hard lump is, also generally on the lower side where this lump is, remains sore.
output: It is possible that the hard lump is due to swelling from the wisdom tooth extraction. It is also possible that it is a hematoma, which is a collection of blood that has pooled in the area. It is important to follow up with your dentist to make sure that the lump is not something more serious. If it is due to swelling, it should go away with time. If it is a hematoma, your dentist may need to drain it.

input: Hello doctor,I had deep unprotected sex for three minutes with a broken condom with a sex worker who looks younger and healthy and aged between 18. It was my first intercourse with a sex worker and I am worrying about expose to HIV. I have started fearing from the minute where I had broken condom intercourse and she said to me that she does not have HIV and they never allow anyone to have sex without a condom because of fear of getting infected. So there is no need to worry but I cannot believe her and started studying about HIV and its symptoms and I have a feeling of infection because I got red dots in my finger pits and cold and throat infection.I want to know what are the red dots on my finger which I got? I got it tested many times in those three months and got a negative result. I am worrying abt six months test.
output: The red dots on your fingers could be a number of things, including an allergic reaction, an infection, or even a skin condition. It is impossible to say for sure without seeing them. As for HIV, it is important to remember that HIV is not transmitted through casual contact, and that the risk of transmission from a single unprotected sexual encounter with a sex worker is very low. However, it is still recommended that you get tested for HIV at the 6 month mark, just to be sure.

input: Hello doctor,I need advice after my second CT chest result. Six months back, I went for a CT scan because I have got chest pain which suddenly comes and goes and I wanted to go for a check-up. The CT showed a right-sided nodule measuring 3 mm and was advised to RPT interval scan in six months. I have done the second CT, the previous nodule is still there and they found another one.In the LLL, a 4 mm nodule is representative of an intrapulmonary lymph node. No suspicious lung lesion. Tiny 3 mm RLL nodule noted. No enlarged lymph nodes. Mild thymic hyperplasia. The partly visualized upper abdominal viscera appear unremarkable. No aggressive bony lesion. They said I do not need to do anything which is strange because there are two nodes now and the second one was not there six months ago. Do I need some kind of medicine therapy to clear my lung from this node or do I need to check if it is growing or not after one year?
output: It is difficult to give you a definitive answer without more information. It is possible that the nodules are benign and do not require any treatment. However, it is also possible that they are indicative of a more serious underlying condition. It is important to discuss your results with your doctor and to follow their advice. Depending on the results of your CT scan, your doctor may recommend further tests or treatments. They may also recommend that you have another CT scan in a year to monitor the nodules and check if they are growing.

input: Hi doctor,I had sex for the first time. After that, I did not get my periods yet. I went to a gynecologist. She had taken my blood sample and it was negative. But, still I have not gotten my periods and it has been a week ahead. What could be the reason for my late periods?
output: It is possible that your body is still adjusting to the hormonal changes that occur after having sex for the first time. It is also possible that the stress of the situation has caused your period to be delayed. If your period does not arrive within the next week or two, it would be a good idea to go back to your gynecologist for further testing.

input: Hello doctor,My friend aged 30 had two drops of phenol mistaking for milk. He vomited and had lot of salt water. Please advice for any side effect.
output: It is difficult to predict the exact side effects of ingesting phenol without knowing the exact amount ingested. However, some of the potential side effects of ingesting phenol include nausea, vomiting, abdominal pain, dizziness, confusion, and difficulty breathing. If your friend is experiencing any of these symptoms, he should seek medical attention immediately.

input: Hello doctor,Some mornings during the week I get a quick flash of numbness over my left temple. It is never at night or during the day. It can happen more than once sometimes. If I move, roll over, or get up, I can make it stop. It does not hurt and is very fast. What does this sound like?
output: This could be a form of migraine aura, which is a neurological symptom that can occur before or during a migraine attack. It is usually described as a visual or sensory disturbance, such as flashes of light, blind spots, or numbness. If you are experiencing this symptom regularly, it would be best to speak to your doctor to discuss further evaluation and treatment options.

input: Hi doctor,My last USG report showed intrauterine pregnancy with 8 mm gestation sac, no fetal and yolk sac. Last week I had brown discharge with mild lower abdominal pain and was prescribed Susten 200 mg (oral). Now, I am feeling the pain frequently in the right lower abdomen with mild bleeding and pain. It is less when I lie on bed. What to do?
output: It is important to follow up with your doctor for further evaluation. You may need to have another ultrasound to assess the pregnancy and to determine the cause of the pain and bleeding. Your doctor may also recommend additional tests or treatments depending on the results of the ultrasound. It is important to follow your doctor's instructions and to take any medications as prescribed.

input: I'm 40 & I've had glandular fever, shingles, influenza and have an autoimmune condition (Hashimoto's disease). I believe I may be more vulnerable than the average person my age to get Coronavirus, due to my weakened immune system? Should I be self isolating? I am ok to do so
output: Yes, it is recommended that you self-isolate if you have a weakened immune system. This is especially important if you are in an area with a high rate of coronavirus cases. It is important to follow the guidelines of your local health authority and practice social distancing, hand washing, and other preventive measures.

input: Hello doctor,I am a 50-year-old female who has had an elevated ferritin level for many years now. My last ferritin level was 342, 20 days back. My ferritin level has been as high as 390. My TIBC, UIBC, iron, and iron saturation have always been within normal range. My glucose has always ranged from 100 to 104. I was tested for hemochromatosis and results are negative. My doctors keep telling me that we will just watch my ferritin level and I have bloodwork done every six months. I was diagnosed with fibromyalgia last year. I am looking for some answers and some help.
output: It is important to understand the cause of your elevated ferritin level. It is possible that your elevated ferritin level is due to your fibromyalgia, as some medications used to treat fibromyalgia can cause an increase in ferritin levels. It is also possible that your elevated ferritin level is due to an underlying medical condition, such as anemia or liver disease. It is important to discuss your symptoms and medical history with your doctor to determine the cause of your elevated ferritin level. Your doctor may recommend further testing, such as a complete blood count, liver function tests, and/or a bone marrow biopsy, to help determine the cause of your elevated ferritin level. Depending on the cause, your doctor may recommend lifestyle changes, dietary modifications, or medications to help manage your elevated ferritin level.

input: Hello doctor,I have had a fishy odor down there since I was in elementary school. I was not sexually active at all either. Just a couple years ago I realized I might have something called bacterial vaginosis. I went to the doctor for it a couple years ago and got prescribed Metronidazole and it did nothing for me. Ever since then I have not really gone to the doctor about it again. I am worried because I have read that BV left untreated can make you infertile. How common is it that this could happen? And do you have any tips for me?
output: Bacterial vaginosis is a common condition that can cause a fishy odor. It is usually treated with antibiotics, such as Metronidazole. However, if the infection is not treated, it can lead to more serious complications, such as infertility. The risk of infertility is low, but it is important to seek medical attention if you are concerned about your symptoms. Your doctor can help you determine the best course of treatment for your condition. Additionally, there are some lifestyle changes that can help reduce the risk of recurrent bacterial vaginosis, such as avoiding douching, wearing loose-fitting clothing, and avoiding scented soaps and products.

input: Hello doctor,My body is getting severe itching after taking a bath or while sweating. Initially, it used to happen only in winter 4 to 5 years back and then gradually started in rainy days also. Now in summer also while sweating. It is so irritating like that I am going to be mad. I have stopped using soap and also took Clonafit 0.25 mg and Betonix- 10 prescribed by a dermatologist but there is no improvement. Please help me out of this.
output: Itching can be caused by a variety of factors, including allergies, skin conditions, and even certain medications. It is important to determine the cause of your itching in order to find the most effective treatment. I recommend that you see a dermatologist for a full evaluation. They may recommend further testing, such as a skin biopsy, to determine the cause of your itching. In the meantime, you can try using a moisturizer to help soothe your skin and reduce itching. You should also avoid using any harsh soaps or detergents, as these can further irritate your skin.

input: Hi doctor,I am a 25-year-old male. I do not have any medical history. Been always healthy. For the past 3 months, I have been experiencing this facial tightness which comes pretty often throughout the day with different intensity. The facial tension usually comes half an hour after I leave the bed. The tightness on my face happens to be on both sides of my face but usually more intense on the right. At times, I can feel it from my neck all the way up to my face. As of recent, I have been feeling this slight burning sensation on my chest to my shoulders as well. Prior to this facial tightness, I have been suffering from this burning feeling on the centre of my chest for about a month. It was my first time experiencing heartburn and I thought it was heart related. Went for X-rays and echo heart ultrasound. Everything came out fine. I have a healthy heart. What made the burning chest sensation go away temporarily is lying down, eating, exercising and drinking alcohol. And the weird part is the same thing helps me relieve my facial tightness temporarily is the same thing as that for the burning chest sensation; lying down, eating, exercising and drinking alcohol.Since having this facial tightness, I have paid numerous visits to different doctors, even the neuro-specialist and they all said it was anxiety. The doctors did facial senses test where they take a piece of fine cotton to touch different parts of my face. I had to close my eyes and tell them where the spot is. I have no troubles at all. I did blood test. It came out normal. They told me I do not need to do any scans and that it was merely anxiety and it will go off by itself. I convinced myself that I had anxiety because of the one month heartburn ordeal that I was suffering from. Even though the facial tightness was there, I tried my utmost best to ignore it. I do not think that I have any anxiety in me now as I try not to think of the weird tightness sensation. However, it has been 3 whole months and now I am getting alarmed and worried that it is still here and with newer sensations as I described above. In all honesty, I do feel that the intensity of the facial tension as compared to I first experienced it, is less. However, it is always there even as when I am typing this. I do not see any physical change on my body. Not sure if it is neuro damage. I am worried sick.Hope I can get some form of advice and diagnosis.
output: It is difficult to diagnose your condition without a physical examination. However, it is possible that you are experiencing a form of facial nerve dysfunction, such as trigeminal neuralgia or Bell's palsy. It is also possible that you are experiencing a form of anxiety disorder, such as generalized anxiety disorder or panic disorder. I would recommend that you see a neurologist for a physical examination and further testing to determine the cause of your symptoms. Additionally, it may be beneficial to speak with a mental health professional to assess for any underlying anxiety or stress that may be contributing to your symptoms.

input: Hello doctor,My mother is 75 years old. She had been treated for TB (tuberculosis) of the abdomen as her ultrasound of abdomen finding was thicken bowel loop. In general terms, it was informed about TB in her abdomen. Accordingly, medicines were given to her as per the advise of a local MD doctor. Treatment continued for three months and due to some discontinuation of medicine it relapsed and again she was diagnosed with Thicken bowel loop as per USG. Again treatment continued.However, while undergoing treatment she lost sensation in her legs and complained of losing sensation in her legs and numbness in her feet and was unable to put on slippers in her feet with difficulty in moving. She also complained that while moving she felt as if she was moving on a bed of soft cotton.Subsequent treatment by neuro experts revealed that overdose of treatment of her TB in abdomen resulted in this condition and she was diagnosed for peripheral neuropathy and was advised for biopsy for proper diagnosis. Meanwhile, she fell and hurt herself which was later on diagnosed that her spine at L3 - L4 was compressed due to felling abruptly and accordingly she was advised to take bed rest for three months. Slowly, she recovered from this condition felt pain in her back and was facing another kind of problem as she could not sit for a longer time and preferred to lay down on the bed.Finding her bad condition subsequetly, we also took consultation from other neuro experts at a prestigious institution where she was prescribed Lupivitin one tablet and Sammy one tablet.When condition persisted thereafter she was given Primosa one tablet daily, Neurox one tablet daily, Maxglobin 50 mg one tablet and Defart 6 mg.But, whenever she was given medicine her condition further aggravated. After about six months of treatment by the neuro expert, she has now been referred to the department of immunology for their advice. Meanwhile, we also took advice from a rheumatologist who diagnosed a kind of arthritis and started treating accordingly. He also started the course of Defzacort (steroid) along with other medicines. The steroid was prescribed with a decreasing dose per week from 60 mg per day to 6 mg per day.However, after taking about two months of steroid course her condition deteriorated and had severe breathlessness. Her blood sugar level also shot up and ultimately she was hospitalized and the treatment of steroid withdrawn. After 15 days of treatment at the hospital she recovered to her previous condition. But, her neuro problem of numbness in her legs and loss of sensation in legs still continues. Please help.
output: It sounds like your mother has been through a lot. It is difficult to give a definitive diagnosis without a full medical evaluation. However, it is possible that her symptoms are due to a combination of her TB treatment, her fall, and her arthritis. It is also possible that she has developed a peripheral neuropathy due to the TB treatment. I would recommend that she see a neurologist for further evaluation and treatment. The neurologist may recommend further testing such as an MRI or nerve conduction studies to help determine the cause of her symptoms. They may also recommend medications or physical therapy to help manage her symptoms.

input: Hi doctor,I am suffering from a mild cold and severe clogging of ears. I am taking Afrin spray for an hour and one pill of Sudafed. I developed a similar condition of cold and sinus infection before six months. I had severe clogging of ears. I was given Amoxicillin for five days and Prednisone 5 mg. My ENT doctor examined my ears and told me that there was no issue with the eardrum. He diagnosed it as eustachian tube issue. Please help.
output: It sounds like you may have a chronic eustachian tube dysfunction. This is a condition where the eustachian tube, which connects the middle ear to the back of the nose, does not open and close properly. This can cause a buildup of fluid in the middle ear, leading to clogged ears and other symptoms. The treatment for this condition is usually a combination of medications and lifestyle changes. Your doctor may recommend a decongestant such as Sudafed to help reduce the swelling in the eustachian tube. They may also recommend a steroid such as prednisone to reduce inflammation. In addition, your doctor may suggest avoiding allergens and irritants that can worsen your symptoms. If these treatments do not help, your doctor may recommend a procedure to open the eustachian tube. This procedure is called a myringotomy.

input: Hi doctor,My wife missed her periods and we doubt she is pregnant. Our first kid is just 1 year old now and it was a Cesarean. We are not in a position to have a second child now. Her LMP was 22nd of last month. I read that Mifepristone can induce abortion. Is it a safe drug? Do we have to consult doctor for taking this drug? What are all the possible side effects? Is that drug 100 percent reliable? Is there any other options? Whether this drug is available without doctor\s prescription? Thank you.
output: Mifepristone is a medication used to induce abortion. It is a safe and effective medication when used as directed. However, it is important to consult with a doctor before taking this medication as it is a prescription drug and should only be taken under the supervision of a healthcare provider. Possible side effects include nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, abdominal pain, and cramping. It is not 100% reliable and other options should be discussed with a healthcare provider. Mifepristone is not available without a doctor's prescription.

input: Hi doctor,I have a question for my mother. My mother is 50 years old. She complains of episodic, sudden loss of weight bearing ability on the left Achilles tendon. This has resulted in two major falls, which resulted in trauma. These are present for past few months and have become more frequent in the last month. She also has pain in her knees bilaterally, which has been attributed to osteoarthritis. She also complains of hip pain associated with swelling and difficulty in standing, lying and changing sides while sleeping. There is episodic stiffness present in the shoulders, which causes some discomfort in raising arms above the shoulder level. She is taking Bisoprolol 5 mg and Amlodipine 5 mg for high BP and it is well-controlled. She has no history of any allergy. She has kidney stones and so occasional pain in the lumbar area. She used to get constipation frequently. She was hospitalized four times for normal vaginal deliveries and once for abortion. She is monogamous with her husband. She has a positive family history of hypertension in mother, CAD in father, mother and brother and uterine cancer in mother. She has a history of menorrhagia and cycles have become more irregular now. Then, diagnostic D and C was performed last year, which was normal. She will not smoke or drink. She sleeps 4 to 6 hours daily and snores at night.
output: Based on the information provided, it is likely that your mother is suffering from a combination of conditions. It is possible that she is experiencing pain in her knees due to osteoarthritis, hip pain due to swelling and difficulty in standing, lying and changing sides while sleeping due to a musculoskeletal disorder, and shoulder stiffness due to a rotator cuff injury. Additionally, her episodic sudden loss of weight bearing ability on the left Achilles tendon could be due to a tendon injury or tear. It is important to have her evaluated by a physician to determine the exact cause of her symptoms and to develop an appropriate treatment plan.

input: Hello doctor,A few months before, I developed a gastric issue that required treatment with PPIs. Soon into using the drugs I developed headaches, dizziness, and nausea. I changed the type of PPI three times but the symptoms persisted. The symptoms included a feeling of pressure above my right ear and behind my right eye. Later, I came off the PPIs and after using over the counter headache painkillers for three days the severity of the headaches eased. But the feeling of pressure remains to this day on the right side of the face. I often feel heavy head or even light-headed with a slight dizziness, often as if I am hung over. The symptoms come and go, but are there every day for differing periods of time. And the constant is this feeling of slight pressure on the right side of my head above the ear and extending sometimes down to the cheek and behind the right eye.
output: It is possible that the headaches and other symptoms you are experiencing are related to the use of PPIs. It is important to speak with your doctor about your symptoms and to discuss any potential side effects of the medications you have been taking. Your doctor may want to do some tests to rule out any other underlying medical conditions that could be causing your symptoms. Additionally, your doctor may suggest lifestyle changes such as reducing stress, getting adequate sleep, and eating a healthy diet to help reduce your symptoms. If your symptoms persist, your doctor may suggest alternative treatments such as acupuncture or massage therapy.

input: Hello doctor,I would like to ask what is the likelihood that my partner who performs oral sex on me has trench mouth or acute necrotizing ulcerative gingivitis? He has no bad breath and he was able to have normal food. Can people with trench mouth have no bad breath and is able to eat normal food?
output: Trench mouth (acute necrotizing ulcerative gingivitis) is a rare condition that is caused by poor oral hygiene and is characterized by painful ulcers in the mouth, bad breath, and difficulty eating. It is unlikely that your partner has trench mouth if he has no bad breath and is able to eat normally. However, it is important to note that trench mouth can be asymptomatic in some cases, so it is still possible that he could have the condition. If you are concerned, it is best to have him evaluated by a dentist or doctor.

input: Hello doctor,My son has developed anxiety symptoms about four years ago. They came completely out of the blue. He was with someone who now has heart palpitations, sweaty palms and feet, and lightheadedness sitting in the living room. We ran a battery of tests when it first happened including TSH, EKG, lung scans, blood panels, etc. and everything was normal. So we went down the path of anxiety. Four years later, the symptoms continued. As my son now has a terrible fear of doctors, we tried a home blood test to get a full thyroid panel. I have attached the results.The blood work came back normal. Low normal TSH, but low normal T4 and lower normal free T4 and free T3. There is nothing that shows an abnormality. However, his urine test showed moderately low iodine and slightly low selenium. I have read that abnormalities in these measures could cause thyroid problems. What am I wondering is if these two indicators are worth further exploration with an endocrinologist knowing that going to the doctor will cause my son a severe panic.Also, is it possible that low iodine could have been a temporary diet thing and it is masking the signs of hyperthyroidism in the blood work? He has all of the symptoms of someone with hyperthyroidism. On a side note, I am hypothyroid, my sister is hypothyroid and my two nieces had Hashimoto\s with my younger niece having thyroid cancer and got her thyroid removed at age of 22. So everyone on my side of the family has thyroid issues. We were wondering if you could please give us some guidance. Looking to see if we need to eliminate thyroid as a possible cause of his symptoms or if it is worth further pursuit.
output: It is possible that the low iodine and selenium levels could be causing thyroid issues, but it is difficult to say without further testing. It is also possible that the low iodine and selenium levels are a result of a dietary deficiency and not the cause of the symptoms. I would recommend speaking to your son's doctor about the possibility of further testing, such as a thyroid ultrasound or a thyroid hormone stimulation test, to determine if there is an underlying thyroid issue. If your son is too anxious to go to the doctor, you may want to consider seeking out a mental health professional to help him manage his anxiety.

input: Hello doctor,I think a spider went up to my right nostril yesterday morning and I am worried about it and frightened. Since then, my nose has been blocked and sore.
output: I understand your concern. It is unlikely that a spider would have gone up your nostril, as spiders typically avoid humans. However, if you are still worried, I recommend that you see your doctor for an examination. They can check for any signs of irritation or infection and provide you with the appropriate treatment.

input: Hello doctor,My symptoms are extreme nausea, headache (mainly right posterior), and very stiff neck. I started with a severe middle ear infection on the right side. Does my MRI show any evidence of mastoiditis, meningitis or a subdural empyema?
output: Without seeing your MRI, it is impossible to answer this question. It is best to consult with your doctor to discuss the results of your MRI and any other tests that may have been done.

input: Hello doctor,I am seriously facing acne pimples problem. Sometimes they occur on my face when I masturbate. If I use Mometasone, it gives a good result.Is it okay to continue this?
output: No, it is not recommended to use Mometasone for acne pimples. Mometasone is a steroid cream and should only be used under the supervision of a doctor. It is not recommended to use it for long periods of time as it can cause side effects such as thinning of the skin, stretch marks, and skin discoloration. It is best to consult a dermatologist for the best treatment for your acne pimples.

input: Hi doctor,My mother has a tumor-like thing in her shoulder. It is like a soft pulpy thing. Right now it is small and not causing much pain. When she works too much, she feels a weight on her shoulder and a mild pain like she has lifted a weight. Is that something cancerous?
output: It is impossible to say whether or not your mother's tumor-like thing is cancerous without further testing. It is important to have her see a doctor for a proper diagnosis. The doctor may recommend imaging tests such as an X-ray or MRI to determine the cause of the tumor-like thing. Depending on the results, the doctor may recommend further testing or treatment.

input: Hi doctor,I am 18 years old. My problem is the teeth has become white for the past few years. The back portion of the teeth has become dark or black. Teeth are quite creamy. Often a bad smell spreads out from my mouth. My mother also suffers from this problem. I use whitening toothpaste but all are in vain. So, please doctor help me and give me a suggestion.
output: It sounds like you may have a condition called dental fluorosis, which is caused by excessive exposure to fluoride during the development of your teeth. This can cause the teeth to become discolored and have a chalky appearance. The best way to treat this is to see a dentist for a professional cleaning and whitening treatment. You may also want to switch to a toothpaste that does not contain fluoride, as this can help reduce the discoloration. Additionally, make sure you are brushing twice a day and flossing regularly to keep your teeth and gums healthy.

input: Hello doctor,My 4 year old son has some kind of rashes from last week. We visited a pediatrician who suggested a dermatologist consultation. I have attached images of the rashes and the prescription. We noticed that it increases in the evenings. Every morning he wakes up with clear skin and during evenings it worsens. He had a fever for two days around the same time it started. He keeps scratching himself. The severity has reduced, but it is not completely gone.
output: It is difficult to diagnose the cause of the rash without seeing your son in person. However, based on the images and the description of the rash, it is likely that your son has a condition called atopic dermatitis. Atopic dermatitis is a chronic skin condition that is characterized by red, itchy, and scaly patches of skin. It is often worse in the evening and can be triggered by environmental factors such as dust, pollen, and pet dander. The treatment for atopic dermatitis includes avoiding triggers, using moisturizers, and taking anti-inflammatory medications. Your son's doctor may also recommend topical corticosteroids or other medications to help reduce the inflammation and itching.

input: Hello doctor,I sustained an injury recently and I had an X-ray. The X-ray shows I have an intraarticular fracture of the right fifth metacarpal with significant ulnar displacement for consideration of ORIF. I went to my local hospital and they did a CT Scan. They sent me home and said to wait for their call to be seen at the Fracture Clinic. I have only buddy taping on my little and next finger. People are telling me it should be strapped or cast right away. I am worried.
output: It is important to follow the instructions of your local hospital and wait for their call to be seen at the Fracture Clinic. It is likely that they will recommend a cast or splint to immobilize the fracture and reduce the risk of further displacement. In the meantime, it is important to keep the area elevated and to avoid any activities that may cause further injury. If you have any concerns, it is best to contact your local hospital for further advice.

input: Hello doctor,My fiancee had a bleeding on the 25th of last month. It lasted for about four to five days. She then got dengue and on the 14th of this month, had mild spotting for a day and a half. The doctor said it could be the dengue causing the spotting. She has not gotten her periods yet. I have read that there could be bleeding during pregnancy as well.
output: It is possible that the spotting could be due to pregnancy, however it is difficult to determine without further testing. It is important to speak to your doctor about your fiancee's symptoms and to have her undergo a pregnancy test to confirm if she is pregnant. Additionally, it is important to monitor her for any other symptoms that may be associated with pregnancy such as nausea, fatigue, and breast tenderness.

input: Hello doctor,I recently have noticed a slight blurriness in my right eye. It is only noticeable when I close my left eye, and so I am not sure how long it has taken for this to develop. input: Hello doctor,I have hydrocele for so many years. But as it is not showing any problem so I left it till now. But now I want to go for hydrocele surgery. output: Hydrocele is a condition in which fluid accumulates in the scrotum. Surgery is the only definitive treatment for hydrocele. Other treatments such as medications, lifestyle changes, and physical therapy may help reduce the symptoms, but they will not cure the condition. Exercise is generally safe for people with hydrocele, but it is important to avoid activities that involve heavy lifting or straining. It is also important to wear supportive underwear and to avoid activities that cause excessive sweating. If you experience any pain or discomfort during exercise, it is important to stop and seek medical advice.

input: Hello doctor,I am 29-years-old male. I am 173 cm in height and weighs about 68 kg. Even that my appearance is manly but in general my physical built is small compared to other men, my face, hands, legs are small also my voice is feminine.My testosterone level is good. My body is too hairy and I did a testosterone test everything was normal. I know there is a lot of studies that say that testosterone can lead to depression but actually at the age of 21 I was suffering from depression and I took testosterone for a month (to gain muscles), my mood was very good and it actually helped my depression. Also, my sexual life and erection are very good, I do masturbate once or twice every two days and I get an erection easily.Kindly help me with these questions:Will testosterone injections help me be more manly? What is the recommended dose that I have to take monthly? What are testosterone injections made from, are they made from an animal source? Will testosterone affects my personality? Do I have to take it for life? What if after some period I decided to stop will I loose what I gained?
output: Testosterone injections can help to increase muscle mass and strength, as well as improve libido and sexual performance. However, it is important to note that testosterone injections are not a “quick fix” and should only be used under the supervision of a qualified medical professional. The recommended dose of testosterone injections will depend on your individual needs and should be determined by your doctor. Testosterone injections are typically made from a synthetic form of the hormone, and not from an animal source. Testosterone injections can affect your personality, but this is usually only in cases of very high doses. If you decide to stop taking testosterone injections, you may experience some side effects, such as decreased muscle mass and strength, decreased libido, and decreased sexual performance. It is important to discuss any potential risks and benefits of testosterone injections with your doctor before starting treatment.

input: Hello doctor,Is there a difference in alcoholic and non-alcoholic mouthwash. Which is better at combating bad breath due to smoking than alcoholic? output: There is a difference between alcoholic and non-alcoholic mouthwash. Non-alcoholic mouthwash is generally better at combating bad breath due to smoking than alcoholic mouthwash. Non-alcoholic mouthwash is less likely to dry out the tissues in the mouth, which can be a problem with alcoholic mouthwash. Non-alcoholic mouthwash can also be more effective at killing bacteria that cause bad breath. However, it is important to note that the best way to combat bad breath due to smoking is to stop smoking.

input: Hi doctor,I have blood dots present under my skin. But it appears only in my arms. I have them on a different arm every morning. I do not have itching, and they are not raised.

If the spots are persistent or accompanied by other symptoms, such as fever, fatigue, or joint pain, it is important to see your doctor for a proper diagnosis.

Then I got vaccinated for rubella to prevent any casualties in the next pregnancy. Now I want to try and conceive, but just now I got my torch panel done again. And now the HSV IGM is positive with 1.15 range along with CMV and rubella IgG positive. Should I wait or can I try to conceive right now? My husband\s torch panel also done, nothing abnormal.I am currently under Folic acid and Multivitamin, for now, to conceive faster. And also a homeopathic medicine for migraine.
output: It is best to wait until you have discussed the results of your TORCH panel with your doctor before trying to conceive. Your doctor can advise you on the best course of action and any additional tests or treatments that may be necessary. Additionally, it is important to discuss any medications you are taking with your doctor before trying to conceive, as some medications may not be safe during pregnancy.

input: Hi doctor,It is regarding my son. He is 14 months and 1 week old. He has not started to walk by his own but started to crawl since 12 months. Is there a problem with his leg muscle?
output: It is not uncommon for children to start walking at different ages. Some children may start walking as early as 9 months, while others may not start until they are 18 months old. If your son is able to crawl and stand up with support, then his leg muscles are likely developing normally. If you are concerned, it is best to speak with your pediatrician to discuss your son's development.

input: Hello doctor,I was suffering from an infection in my tonsil for the past four days. I went to an ENT specialist four days ago. He told me there is an infection and advised me antibiotic.Now my pain in the tonsil has gone, but I am still feeling something stuck in my left side of the throat where there was tonsil pain. I do not have any problem with swallowing. Kindly advise me the needful.
output: It is possible that the infection has not completely cleared yet and that is why you are still feeling something stuck in your throat. I would recommend that you finish the course of antibiotics prescribed by your ENT specialist and also take a throat swab test to confirm that the infection has cleared. If the infection has not cleared, you may need to take a different antibiotic. Additionally, you can also take over the counter pain medications to help with the discomfort.

input: Hello doctor,Around a year ago, some red pimples started appearing around my mouth, chin, forehead, and my nose. These small red pimples create a red area when seen from far away because they are very small and inflamed. It never disappears. My skin always feels stuck and not flexible and with a mildly itchy or burning sensation. No matter how much moisturizer I apply, it does not help. I am using Eucerin atopic control moisturizer and a gel cleanser with Hyaluronan. I even tried using Metronidazole and tea oil, but again it did not help. I have also tried to stop using anything on my face for some days, but it stayed the same. I am 24 years old now, and I never had acne tendencies when I was a teenager, and my skin always looked very smooth. My birth control pill is still the same as it was when I first started taking it, which wad around ten years ago. I do not use steroid creams nor fluoride toothpaste. How can I get rid of this? It was not there before a year. I am attaching a picture of my face. Thanks.
output: It is difficult to diagnose your condition without seeing you in person. However, it is possible that you are experiencing a skin condition called perioral dermatitis. This is a common skin condition that is characterized by red, inflamed bumps around the mouth, chin, forehead, and nose. It is often caused by the use of topical steroids, which can cause the skin to become irritated and inflamed. It is also possible that you are experiencing an allergic reaction to a product or ingredient that you are using on your skin. If you have not already done so, it is important to see a dermatologist for an evaluation and to discuss treatment options. The dermatologist may recommend a topical cream or ointment to help reduce inflammation and itching, as well as a change in your skin care routine.

input: Hi doctor,I asked a question to you this morning. You advised me not to take contraceptive pills since I have the DIU MIRENA. But I have another question. Here is my question: There are five pills left in the blister, and because of your advice I would like to quit right now from taking pills. Is it alright to stop now or should I finish the pills this month and then stop taking them?
output: It is perfectly fine to stop taking the contraceptive pills now. You do not need to finish the pills this month. However, it is important to note that you may experience some side effects such as irregular bleeding or spotting when you stop taking the pills. If you experience any of these side effects, please contact your doctor.

input: Hi doctor,I am coming here for what I think may be possible lower back muscle spasms. I originally felt the pain after playing lots of baseballs (swinging a baseball bat many times). I have symptoms such as tightness, limited mobility or restricted range of motion, throbbing pain, and sometimes it gets so bad that it became hard for me to even walk or sit! I went to my athletic trainer a month ago, and she told me she thinks it is just an aggravated muscle spasm. So she told me to just give it some rest from the activity that hurt it. So I gave it about a month, in which it seemed there was no pain. But as soon as I tried to do the activity that hurt me in the first place, it went right back to hurting. It would be of great help for any assistance. What should I do now?
output: It sounds like you may have a muscle strain or sprain in your lower back. It is important to rest the area and avoid activities that cause pain. You should also consider applying ice to the area for 15-20 minutes several times a day to reduce inflammation and pain. You may also want to take an over-the-counter anti-inflammatory medication such as ibuprofen or naproxen to help reduce pain and inflammation. If the pain persists or worsens, you should see your doctor for further evaluation and treatment.

input: Hello doctor, My partner had a miscarriage unknowingly that she was pregnant five to eight weeks maybe? She had negative home pregnancy tests, a negative test at the doctor, and had a miscarriage the next day after doctors test. My question is, could it be possible there is another fetus remaining inside? I only ask because we each have one parent that is a twin. Please advise.She thought she was on her period the entire week. Bled for seven days. Sheattributed it to the Plan-b pill she took several weeks back. We hadunprotected sex but I still pulled out. She is on birth control andused a Plan-b pill. How is any of this miscarriage stuffpossible especially after just seeing the doctor the day beforemiscarriage?
output: It is possible that there could be another fetus remaining inside, however it is unlikely. It is more likely that the miscarriage was caused by the Plan B pill or the birth control. It is also possible that the negative pregnancy test was a false negative, and that the miscarriage was caused by the pregnancy itself. It is important to speak to your partner's doctor to determine the cause of the miscarriage and to discuss any further testing that may be necessary.

input: Hello doctor,I was diagnosed with dysphonia about a month ago. I have had a couple of speech therapy sessions but progress is glacial. I am still hoarse and in pain. I have been on 40 mg of Omeprazole for a month and Gaviscon Double Action for two weeks. I feel like the back of my throat is still swollen and I have pain in the corners of my throat. This only briefly eases when I really do some throat opening exercises. I cannot talk for very long without everything getting sore still. I have been like this since the beginning of the year since I had a chest infection and pneumonia. My mouth is now getting sore from all the Gaviscon tablets as the liquid irritates the corners of my throat. I really do not know what else I can do. I am having panic attacks and starting to feel like the only option is to take my life. I had a post nasal drip for most of the year so far and I am trying to get my salivary glands to work again properly.
output: I am so sorry to hear that you are feeling so overwhelmed and desperate. It sounds like you have been through a lot and are struggling to cope. It is important to remember that you are not alone and that there are people who can help you. I would recommend that you speak to your doctor about your symptoms and the medications you are taking. They may be able to adjust your medications or suggest other treatments that may help. Additionally, it may be beneficial to speak to a mental health professional about your panic attacks and suicidal thoughts. They can provide you with the support and resources you need to cope with your current situation.

input: Hello doctor,I had a secondary burn on my calf, after a month of self-treating. It just got worse. I play soccer and that and the sweat is what was irritating it. So I finally went to the doctor and they prescribed me SMZ, TMP DS. I took it for about a week until I realized I was having a lot of side effects and an allergic reaction especially around my mouth. At first I thought I was just breaking out. Then it was not like sores or blisters. I kept self-treating the rash around my mouth and stopped taking the antibiotics. For a couple days it was gone. I was happy. Then I was in the sun one day for soccer and it was just like another rash but worse. I stayed home from school, did not do anything because I just wanted to get it better. But now it looks really bad. I believe I have perioral dermatitis. It is red patches all around my mouth. It is really dry and scaly, also there are like white-heads around my mouth also but they are not whiteheads. I would try to moisturize it with coconut oil or tea tree oil but I think that is what made it worse.
output: It sounds like you may have developed a contact dermatitis from the antibiotics you were taking. Contact dermatitis is an allergic reaction to a substance that comes in contact with the skin. It is important to avoid the substance that is causing the reaction and to use a mild, fragrance-free moisturizer to help soothe the skin. You should also avoid any further use of coconut oil or tea tree oil, as these can be irritating to the skin. If the rash does not improve with these measures, you should see a dermatologist for further evaluation and treatment.

input: Hello doctor,Attached is a treadmill stress test result. I would like to obtain technical info regarding these results, particularly regarding the infarction. I would appreciate the severity of this infarction and whether it could be a machine error. Could you also tell me by perhaps drawing on the shot what waves and shapes indicate problems?
output: Thank you for your question. Unfortunately, it is not possible to provide a detailed technical analysis of the treadmill stress test result without a more detailed medical history and a physical examination. The infarction seen on the treadmill stress test result could be indicative of a heart attack, but it could also be due to a machine error or other factors. It is important to discuss the results with your doctor to determine the cause and severity of the infarction. Generally, the presence of ST segment depression or elevation, T wave inversion, or Q waves on the ECG tracing can indicate a heart attack. However, it is important to note that the presence of these features does not necessarily mean that a heart attack has occurred. Your doctor can provide more information about the specific features seen on the ECG tracing and their significance.

input: Hello doctor,If TSH range is 18.64, does it mean any problem?

input: Hi doctor, I have one white lump around the tonsil area in my throat. It has been there a good few months now and the area is swollen. Is this cancer?

input: Hello doctor,I have a best friend who suffers from anxiety and I saw her almost dying today because of a panic attack she had. All her life she thought she had a problem with her heart but she went to see a doctor and he said she is in perfect health. She starts shaking and cannot breathe and I am really scared and try to calm her down but she cannot breathe. She cannot stop shaking for at least half an hour. I do not know what to do and I hope you can tell me.
output: It sounds like your friend is having a panic attack. Panic attacks can be very frightening and overwhelming, and it is understandable that you are scared and want to help her. The best thing you can do is to stay with her and provide reassurance and support. Talk to her in a calm and soothing voice and remind her that she is safe and that the attack will pass. Encourage her to focus on her breathing and to take slow, deep breaths. You can also suggest that she try some relaxation techniques such as progressive muscle relaxation or guided imagery. If the attack persists, it is important that she seek professional help from a mental health professional.

input: Hello doctor,I had elevated ALT levels between 50-130 for the past one and half years with slight enlargement. Recently, I have elevated AST levels. There is no hepatitis or inflammatory diseases, alcohol, drug use, or fatty liver, or Addison\s.Liver biopsy showed inflammation, but a resolving process likely attributed to a year long Lyme disease treatment with various pharmaceuticals but discontinued two years ago. Liver enzymes dropped to 50 ALT, but have recently elevated to 130 ALT.At this point, there is no known cause. I was told to continue to wait and see. I would like to take a different approach and determine if there is something my hepatologist is not seeing. The current medications are Lamictal and Gabapentin, Trazodone. I had abdominal CT, abdominal MRI, liver biopsy, ultrasounds, and a significant amount of blood work.
output: It is difficult to provide a definitive answer without more information. However, it is possible that the elevated ALT and AST levels could be due to the medications you are taking. Lamictal and Gabapentin can cause elevated liver enzymes, and Trazodone can cause liver damage. It is also possible that the Lyme disease treatment could have caused some damage to the liver that is still affecting your liver enzymes. I would recommend speaking to your hepatologist about the possibility of changing your medications or reducing the dosage to see if that helps to reduce your liver enzymes. Additionally, it may be beneficial to have further tests done to determine if there is any underlying cause for the elevated liver enzymes.

input: Hi doctor,I have a small pimple on the penis and testicles for the past six years. I consulted a doctor a long time ago. The doctor told me that it is normal. Please help me.

input: Hello doctor,After unsafe exposure, I got 49 days ELISA antibody test done, 71 days HIV proviral DNA PCR test, 87 days ELISA antibody test. All were negative. The antibody test I took is not a fourth generation test. Is it conclusive or should I take another test? If I repeat the HIV test after six months what is the chance of staying negative? I am facing the problem like small bumps in the tongue, from the last two days a little bit of pain below ear region and it is a little swollen. Is it due to HIV? I am stressed, scared, full of tension. These are hampering my life. I do not know what to do. Today I am in the 107th day of exposure.
output: It is very reassuring that all of your HIV tests have been negative. The HIV antibody test you took is considered to be conclusive at 3 months post exposure. Therefore, you do not need to take another test. The symptoms you are experiencing are not indicative of HIV infection. It is likely that your symptoms are due to stress and anxiety. It is important to take care of your mental health and to find ways to reduce your stress and anxiety. If your symptoms persist, it is best to consult your doctor for further evaluation.

input: Hello doctor,I am 16 years old, and I wear contact lenses. I have never really taken them off. input: Hello doctor,I am 26 years old. I have seen my period in the second month of last year and miss it up for a further two months. But anytime I have sexual intercourse, I will bleed and past lots of blood clots for at least three days and then stop, and I waited for four days. input: Hello doctor,I have an odd thing happening in my left eye. I see a flash of light when I look right to left in the left side of my eye. It is a curve from top to bottom. It happens in daylight, nighttime, and even in the dark with my eyes closed. I move my pupil left to right and see a bright arc of light. I cannot make it stay there, it just flashes as I move my eye balls left to right. Any ideas?

It is usually characterized by flashes of light, zigzag lines, or blind spots in the vision. It is important to see an ophthalmologist for a full evaluation to determine the cause of your symptoms. Treatment may include medications, lifestyle changes, or other therapies.

output: It is difficult to say whether or not your testosterone levels are too low without knowing more about your medical history and other factors. However, it is possible that your low HGH levels could be contributing to your short stature. It is also possible that your erectile dysfunction could be related to your low testosterone levels, but it is difficult to say without more information. If you are concerned about your testosterone levels, it would be best to speak to your doctor about it. They may be able to recommend lifestyle changes or medications that can help to increase your testosterone levels. input: Hello doctor,I am six days post operative from a full tummy tuck with liposuction and muscle repair. I feel that I am recovering normally from what I was told and what I read. input: Hi doctor,Five years ago my mother was diagnosed with fibromyalgia. I think she also has rheumatoid arthritis. For the past five years, she was managing the pain with anti-inflammatory medicine, Lyrica, Mythycobal, Voltaren injections, herbal creams, etc. You can see the veins in her hands popping out. I also realized that the pain has got worse now.For about 12 months the doctor put her only on Prednisolone 5 mg/day and painkiller when necessary. She was fine till last month but the pain increased in her hands now. In the daytime she is fine and the pain starts mildly in the evening. When she lies down in the bed she gets electrical tingling in her legs by which her sleep gets disturbed. She has undergone several tests last week and I attached them for your reference. She did not consult a rheumatologist yet. What medication can I give to reduce the inflammation and cure her? Her ESR, CPR, and ANA are quite high. The pain in her hands and the tingling in her legs at night are agonizing her life. Kindly provide your expert advice.
output: I'm sorry to hear about your mother's condition. It sounds like she is suffering from both fibromyalgia and rheumatoid arthritis. The best course of action would be to consult a rheumatologist for a proper diagnosis and treatment plan. The tests you have provided suggest that she has an inflammatory condition, which could be causing the pain and tingling in her legs. The rheumatologist may recommend medications such as non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs), corticosteroids, or disease-modifying antirheumatic drugs (DMARDs) to reduce inflammation and pain. input: Hello doctor,I have been given hepatitis B blood test that showed the HBsAg negative and the hepatitis B core antibody image as positive. I am currently getting labs done for hepatitis B Surf Ab Quant, HBsAg screen, hepatitis B virus profile, and panel. I am getting conflicting information on websites and from healthcare professionals that hepatitis B does not ever leave the body but I also read that 98 % of the people who get it cleared the disease from the body. My question is what is the real answer, can I beat the virus and remove it from my body completely leaving only anti-bodies?
output: The answer to your question is that it is possible to clear the virus from the body, but it is not common. The majority of people who are infected with hepatitis B will remain infected for life. However, some people are able to clear the virus from their body, usually within 6 months of infection. This is known as spontaneous clearance. If you have tested positive for the hepatitis B core antibody, it is likely that you have been infected with the virus at some point in your life, but it is possible that you have cleared it. To determine if you have cleared the virus, you will need to have additional tests done, such as the hepatitis B surface antigen (HBsAg) test.

2. Overuse or repetitive strain from activities such as running, lifting, or sitting for long periods of time.

3. Pregnancy or childbirth, which can cause the ligaments that support the SI joint to become lax.

4. Arthritis or other degenerative joint conditions.

5. Infection or inflammation of the joint.

6. Structural abnormalities, such as a misalignment of the pelvis or sacrum.

7. Nerve impingement or compression.

It is possible that the white patches you are experiencing are due to the Elidel, but it is also possible that they are due to the rash itself. If the patches are due to the Elidel, they should fade over the course of several weeks to months. If the patches are due to the rash, they may take longer to fade.

If the patches do not fade over time, you may want to consider other treatment options such as laser treatments or topical creams. Your doctor can help you determine the best course of action for your particular situation.

input: Hi,I am a 65-year-old female. My sugar level before three months was fasting 180 mg/dl, postprandial 253 mg/dl and HbA1C 8 %. After having medication, the test done a few days back showed fasting 93 mg/dl, postprandial 80 mg/dl, HbA1C 7 %, triglycerides 259 and VLDL cholesterol 51.80. Also, the blood pressure is 200/100 mmHg.I am taking the following medications:Glycomet GP 2 (one tablet in the morning and one tablet in the evening daily).Galvus 50 (one tablet in the morning daily).Tricinod 10/6.5 (one tablet morning daily).Cilamet XL 50 (one tablet evening daily).Neurokind LC (one tablet afternoon daily).Ecosprin AV 75 (one tablet evening daily).Trika 0.5 (one tablet evening daily).In the past, I was on Met XL 100 (one tablet in the morning daily), Met XL (one tablet in the evening daily), Stamlo 0.5 (one tablet in the morning daily), Ecosprin AV 75 (one tablet evening daily) and Gemer 1 (one tablet morning daily).Currently, my blood pressure is high and feeling heavy on in one side the of head and weak. output: It is difficult to give a definitive answer without a more detailed medical history and physical examination. It is important to discuss your current medications and symptoms with your doctor to determine if any changes need to be made. Your doctor may also want to adjust your medications or add additional medications to help control your blood pressure and sugar levels.

I had tonsillitis three times before and I have been prescribed Co-amoxiclav, Dequadin, and Strepsils. Please help.
output: It sounds like you may have a bacterial infection, such as tonsillitis, and it is important that you see a doctor as soon as possible. The medications you have been prescribed may help to reduce the symptoms, but it is important to get a proper diagnosis and treatment plan from a doctor. In the meantime, you should rest, drink plenty of fluids, and take over-the-counter medications such as ibuprofen or paracetamol to help reduce the fever.

input: Hi doctor,I am 27 years old, and I have an embarrassing problem with my penis. The opening of my penis, from where the urine comes out is not at the tip, and it is slightly lower. I am still a virgin. Will it be a problem for my sex life? Is it a major problem?
output: It is not a major problem and should not affect your sex life. It is a common variation in anatomy and should not cause any issues. If you are concerned, you can speak to your doctor about it.

input: Hello doctor,About a year ago, I started with tingling symptoms on the face, which was most consistent but also arms, legs, and torso those are more intermittent on both sides of the body. At time B12 was low started taking it after a couple of months symptoms better. Also, I had regular neuro examination and normal MRI of the head and cervical spine.After a few months, I stopped B12 levels up then a few months after the same symptoms again and B12 low again. Started back on B12 symptoms went away in a couple of months. Last month it started signs yet, but still, on B12 it is very high 1270 so symptoms not due to that. Had another head MRI was normal. My cervical MRI did show moderate to severe changes throughout of narrowing of foraminal in all areas c3 to c7. Also flattening of ventral cord c3 through 6. I am anxious about it being multiple sclerosis.
output: It is difficult to say whether or not you have multiple sclerosis without further testing. It is possible that the changes seen on your cervical MRI could be causing your symptoms, but it is also possible that the symptoms are due to something else. I recommend that you follow up with your doctor to discuss your symptoms and the results of your MRI. They may recommend further testing to determine the cause of your symptoms.

input: Hello doctor,My first baby is healthy and my blood group is A positive and my wife\s blood group is B negative. Now, my wife is again pregnant and has completed 26 weeks of pregnancy. She has developed antibodies and the latest ICT with titer test results show 1:64. Last week, we also did sonography and that did not have any impact on the baby.Now, the doctor suggests giving some steroids in this week which will help to develop the baby\s lungs faster to prevent any complication. Is it safe? If my baby\s blood group is also negative then are there any possibilities for antibodies to develop in my wife or does the baby\s blood group does not matter at all? Should I go ahead with NIPT to find the baby\s blood group?
output: It is safe to give steroids to your wife in this week to help develop the baby's lungs faster. The baby's blood group does not necessarily affect the development of antibodies in your wife, but it is possible that the baby's blood group could be a factor. It is recommended that you go ahead with NIPT to determine the baby's blood group, as this will help to determine the risk of any complications due to the antibodies.

input: Hello doctor,I am a 30 year old male, who is a competitive athlete. I do not have any structural or plumbing heart issues. I have been diagnosed with WPW accidentally, and I am waiting for an ablation in 17 days. I am mostly asymptomatic, and I never had any extremely rapid heart rates. My resting heart rate is actually in the 40\s. However, I do sometimes get palpitations and every once in awhile get a run of 5 to 7 in a row. The EP I saw in the hospital prescribed me Flecainide 50 mg, twice daily. I saw another EP, who was a much older guy, as a second opinion. He seems to think I do not need the Flecainide, and maybe not even the ablation. I do not agree with him on the ablation due to recent medical studies on WPW and how ablation is recommended even for asymptomatic patients, especially athletes.My question is regarding Flecainide. I have not had any palpitations since I began taking it a few days ago, but I want to make sure this drug is not putting me at risk for creating a dangerous rhythm. Reading case studies and medical journals, it seems there is some risk. I have not been known to go into AF, and besides palpitations, I am asymptomatic with WPW. Do you think Flecainide at this dosage is safe and reasonable for the next two weeks, until my ablation?
output: Flecainide is generally considered safe for short-term use in asymptomatic WPW patients, and it is often used to help control the heart rate prior to an ablation. However, it is important to discuss the risks and benefits of this medication with your doctor, as there is a risk of developing a dangerous rhythm with its use. It is also important to note that the risk of developing a dangerous rhythm is higher in athletes, so it is important to be monitored closely while taking this medication. Ultimately, it is up to you and your doctor to decide if the benefits of taking Flecainide outweigh the risks.

input: Hello doctor,I have depression for the last 4 years. I just want to know what Depakin are because my old psychiatrist gave me that medicine and I did not use it. It is about 5 months now but I do not feel good these days. I just feel depressed.
output: Depakin is an antidepressant medication that belongs to a class of drugs called tricyclic antidepressants. It is used to treat depression and other mood disorders. It works by increasing the levels of certain chemicals in the brain that are responsible for regulating mood. It can help to reduce symptoms of depression such as feelings of sadness, loss of interest in activities, difficulty sleeping, and changes in appetite. It may take several weeks for the full effects of Depakin to be felt. It is important to take the medication as prescribed and to talk to your doctor if you have any questions or concerns.

input: Hello doctor,I am a mother of two - 1.7 months and 4 months old. I am currently breastfeeding the younger one. I have a problem with my right breast which makes me doubt if it is something related to cancer. Nowadays it is getting really dry and there appear cracks on my nipple. I used Avalon nipple cream. But from yesterday my breast has shrunk and my nipples too. There are a few lumps on my nipple as well. Even though I apply cream it is not getting relieved. It is getting worse day by day.
output: It is difficult to diagnose a condition without a physical examination. I would recommend that you make an appointment with your doctor to have your breast examined. Your doctor can also provide you with more information about the possible causes of your symptoms and the best treatment options. In the meantime, you should continue to use the nipple cream and make sure to keep your breasts clean and dry.

input: Hello doctor,We are a newly married couple and had sex two days back without any prevention from pregnancy. Could you please suggest any prevention tablet which can prevent the pregnancy after sex without any side effects?
output: There are several forms of emergency contraception available, such as the morning-after pill, which can be taken up to 72 hours after unprotected sex to help prevent pregnancy. It is important to note that emergency contraception is not 100% effective and should not be used as a regular form of birth control. It is also important to speak with your doctor about any potential side effects before taking any medication.

input: Hi doctor,I am 26 years old female. I have an abscess in my tooth for over a year now. I am getting it infected for the second time now. The previous infection was before six months. It is present at the bottom of one of my lower molars. It hurts me a lot. How long will it take to spread throughout the body?
output: It is unlikely that the abscess will spread throughout your body. However, it is important to seek treatment as soon as possible to prevent further infection and complications. Depending on the severity of the infection, it may take a few days to a few weeks for the infection to resolve.

input: Hello doctor,I have fever of 38 to 38.5 over past seven days. Right testicle swollen for the past five days and left testicle swollen for the past four days. On IV antibiotics, Cravit and Doribax (which replaced Rochephin). C-reactive test above 231. The doctors still cannot identify the cause. Any thoughts or recommendations? Your doctor may order additional tests such as a urine culture, blood tests, or imaging studies to help identify the cause of your symptoms. Treatment will depend on the underlying cause. input: Hi doctor,My daughter had braces for four years but her midline is off and she has a gummy smile. Her bite is fine but her teeth are not properly aligned and she does not have bone on her left side. Her orthodontist referred her to a maxillofacial surgeon who says she needs her upper jaw broken and rotated clockwise and slightly up to compensate for the lack of bone and her bottom jaw also has to be broken and rotated clockwise. It would all then be held by plates and screws. My biggest concern is that she is a beautiful girl and he says that her face will not change at all. Is that true with this kind of procedure?
output: It is difficult to answer this question without seeing your daughter and her specific situation. Generally speaking, the goal of maxillofacial surgery is to improve the alignment of the teeth and jaw without significantly changing the appearance of the face. However, it is possible that there may be some subtle changes in the shape of the face after the surgery. It is important to discuss your concerns with the maxillofacial surgeon and to make sure that you are comfortable with the proposed treatment plan.

input: Hello doctor,I am a 21 year old female. Yesterday, doctors have checked my blood. I am visiting a hospital frequently as I have iron deficiency anemia. The thing I am scared about is, my doctor asked me why my ferritin has not increased (just the opposite, it has decreased from 5.79 to 5.77) after three months of taking iron supplements. My other iron levels are at 39 which has increased considering those references. But, that was probably because I did not use the medicine correctly, I was only taking 5 mg a day. Another thing I am worried about is, my lymphocytes kind of got increased in my blood: (52.8) - the reference is 19.4 to 44.9, and the other one is 3.57. My neutrophils kind of decreased too (36.9) and the reference was between 41.0 to 73.0.In the last week, I had a viral infection as both my parents were sick. Is it why my levels got high? My WBC is 6.77 and RBC is 4.52. My hemoglobin is also increasing actually, last time I checked, it was 11.0 and now it is 11.2. Still low, but it was good to see that it was increasing. My thrombocyte levels got higher again, unfortunately. The first time I was told that I was anemic, my thrombocyte levels were on 485, then in my second blood test (after using iron supplements correctly it decreased to 380. And yesterday, when I checked, it increased to 435 (reference is 156 to 373).I was also told that I have an infection in my urinary system and he gave me antibiotics. Honestly, I have been always getting suspected about it since my anemia has started. Should I be worried about my condition or is it normal?
output: It is normal for your ferritin levels to fluctuate, especially when you are taking iron supplements. It is also normal for your lymphocytes and neutrophils to fluctuate, especially if you have had a recent viral infection. It is important to make sure that you are taking your iron supplements correctly and that you are following your doctor's instructions. If you are still concerned about your condition, it is best to speak to your doctor about your concerns.

input: Hi doctor,I am 27 years old, and I have multiple symptoms including nervousness, anxiety and weight loss. These symptoms are troubling me a lot. On my final blood test, my thyroid results came normal. But still, I have the symptoms. I am trying for a baby. But I heard an issue that underlying or undiagnosed thyroid issue could become a terrible one during pregnancy. Do I need to consult an endocrinologist soon? output: It is important to consult an endocrinologist to determine the cause of your symptoms. It is possible that your symptoms are related to an underlying thyroid issue, and an endocrinologist can help you determine the best course of action. It is also possible that your symptoms are related to other medical conditions, and an endocrinologist can help you determine the cause and provide treatment options. It is important to discuss your plans for pregnancy with your doctor, as an undiagnosed or untreated thyroid issue can cause complications during pregnancy.

input: Hi doctor,I have red bumps, which are non-itchy and keep on spreading. Also, I am attaching the picture for your reference. Please explain me.
output: From the picture you have provided, it appears that you have a skin condition known as keratosis pilaris. This is a common skin condition that is characterized by small, red bumps on the skin. It is usually found on the upper arms, thighs, and buttocks, but can also appear on the face. The bumps are usually painless and non-itchy, and can become more noticeable when the skin is dry. Treatment for keratosis pilaris includes moisturizing the skin regularly, using gentle exfoliating products, and avoiding harsh soaps and cleansers.

input: Hello doctor,On my left eye, on the corner, nearest my nose on the sclera there is a tiny clear bubble. I have has this for years and it does not bother me. input: Hello doctor,What is HMD (hereditary macular degeneration) and what is the maximum possible impact of this disease in future on a person? Can this disease make one blind?
output: HMD (hereditary macular degeneration) is an inherited eye disorder that causes progressive damage to the macula, the part of the eye responsible for central vision. It is the leading cause of vision loss in people over the age of 50. The maximum possible impact of this disease in the future on a person is that it can lead to severe vision loss and even blindness. In some cases, it can cause complete blindness in both eyes.

input: Hello doctor,I am 35-year-old male. My weight is 77 kg and height is 5 feet 6 inches. What is a skipping pulse? Is it blockage in the heart or not? My test reports is as follows, Cholesterol : 247, Triglycerides : 283, Hdl : 43, Ldl : 149, VLDL : 57, Non-Hdl cholesterol : 204, Lipoprotein a : 94, HS-CRP : 8, Sugar fasting : 90, and BP mostly : 130 / 85.
output: A skipping pulse is a condition in which the heart skips a beat or beats irregularly. It is usually caused by an electrical problem in the heart, such as an abnormal heart rhythm. It is not usually caused by blockage in the heart. Your test results indicate that your cholesterol and triglyceride levels are slightly elevated, but your HDL, LDL, and VLDL levels are within normal range. Your non-HDL cholesterol level is slightly elevated, but your lipoprotein a and HS-CRP levels are within normal range. Your sugar fasting level is also within normal range. Your blood pressure is also within normal range. Therefore, it is unlikely that your skipping pulse is caused by any of the conditions indicated by your test results.

The sequence is compared with the reference sequence NM-004343 for the analysis of mutations." Hematologist prescribed me Anagrelide 0.5 mg. Do I have to worry? Can it be cured by medication?

input: Hi doctor, I am having frequent urination and feeling extremely thirsty, especially during the night after dinner and before bed.
