output: It is unlikely that you have diabetes based on your blood sugar levels. However, it is possible that you may have a condition called polyuria, which is characterized by frequent urination and excessive thirst. It is important to discuss your symptoms with your doctor to determine the cause and the best course of treatment. Additionally, it is important to monitor your blood sugar levels regularly to ensure that they remain within the normal range.

input: Hello doctor,Suddenly, my right eye got smaller than my left eye for a few seconds (15 seconds) and then it came back to normal. It has happened a few times now. Why is this?
output: This could be due to a condition called myasthenia gravis, which is a disorder of the muscles that causes them to become weak and fatigued. It can cause the eyelids to droop and the eyes to appear smaller than normal. It is important to see your doctor for a proper diagnosis and treatment.

input: Hi,I am getting white hair from last 3 years, and the number has increased in the last 3 months. Is this the effect of water. Kindly suggest the medicine for this problem.

If these measures do not help, you may want to consult a dermatologist for further advice.

input: Hi doctor,My scar revision surgery is not healing well, and it seems worse than last week. Please see the attached picture. Is it worth getting a botox to stop frowning till I am healed? I am using a vitamin C and silicone scar cream to attempt better removal of hyperpigmentation. Is this a problem? I cannot tell if it is this or the creasing making it worse. I am starting to get very depressed about this scar revision. It was bad enough getting mugged and getting this wound. Now it is not healing even after a scar revision surgery. Thanks.
output: It is difficult to say without seeing the scar in person, but it is possible that the creasing of your forehead is causing the scar to worsen. It is worth trying to tape your forehead to see if that helps. Botox may also be an option to help reduce the creasing, but it is important to discuss this with your doctor first. The use of a vitamin C and silicone scar cream may help with the hyperpigmentation, but it is important to follow the instructions of your doctor and use the cream as directed. It is also important to be patient with the healing process, as it can take several months for a scar to fully heal. If you are feeling depressed about the scar, it is important to reach out to a mental health professional for help.

input: Hi doctor,I have PCOD, and I am planning to conceive. I am under Macfolate and Metformin tablets for the past seven months. I have regular periods for the past six months. This month, on the 11th day, I missed my period. After two days, when I checked for pregnancy, I got a negative result. Again after seven days, I got a negative result after checking for pregnancy. input: Hello doctor,I am 17, and my wisdom teeth started developing from more than six months, I get sudden occasion pains, it is more like pulsating, the pain feels so bad, and it makes my whole jaw ache, I cannot even eat for one to two days properly. The pains are so sharp, and I can see my wisdom teeth coming out like a halfway through, it is so painful, what should I do?
output: It sounds like you may be experiencing wisdom tooth impaction. This is when the wisdom teeth are unable to fully erupt through the gums due to lack of space or other factors. This can cause pain and discomfort. I recommend that you see an oral surgeon or dentist to have your wisdom teeth evaluated. They can determine if the teeth need to be extracted or if there are other treatments that can help.

input: Hi doctor,My mother has a lump on her breast. She underwent a biopsy. In the biopsy report, it came as benign. Another test showed that she has stage 3 breast cancer (she has no symptoms) and the doctor advised us for a mastectomy. The doctor recommended us to do some tests such as blood count, breast X-ray, and ultrasound. The results came normal (there is no mass lesion present, and there is no metastasis seen). Is there any confirmatory test available to find breast cancer?
output: Yes, there are other confirmatory tests available to diagnose breast cancer. These include mammography, MRI, PET scan, and biopsy. Depending on the results of the initial tests, your doctor may recommend one or more of these tests to confirm the diagnosis.

input: Hello doctor,My mother is facing water discharge from her eyes. With water, there is also some thick semi-liquid discharge from sides. input: Hello doctor,I play games on my laptop for hours a day and after a few hours, my eyes become little blurry especially my left eye. input: Hello doctor,I am a 31-year-old male with a history of closed globe injury in the right eye 10 years ago. At that time, my vision in the right eye was hand movements only and I was diagnosed with a macular injury. Three months later, my vision slowly improved to 6/36. However, my right eye started to deviate (exotropia) and I started experiencing diplopia. My main problem is diplopia. I have used prisms, but of no use. When I try to focus on an image, I have severe diplopia. The diplopia disappears when I try to correct the squint. At present, I am doing higher studies and the diplopia is really bothering me. output: It is difficult to answer your question without a full eye examination. However, it is possible that a squint surgery may be of some benefit in reducing your diplopia. It is important to have a full eye examination to determine the cause of your diplopia and to determine if a squint surgery is the best option for you. I would recommend that you see an ophthalmologist for a full eye examination and to discuss the best treatment options for you.

input: Hi doctor,I have a lower wisdom tooth that has been infected chronically for well over a year. I also have an upper molar that is broken decayed and has been like this for years. The wisdom tooth oozes green pus if you apply pressure with a cotton swab. The decayed tooth is mildly painful. I saw my dentist a few days ago, who did not seem overly concerned. She slightly cleaned the gums around the wisdom tooth and prescribed me Cephalexin and sent me on my way. I have been taking Cephalexin for a few days, and yet the tooth is still oozing. My throat is red and irritated, the gums inflamed and there is no swelling in the mouth. Also, my nostril on that side is tender and painful. I am severely worried about the infection spreading to either my heart or my brain. In fact, I read an article a few days ago about a 26 year old who died from a tooth infection spreading.I do not have a fever. I have mild nausea. It is tender on that side of my jaw. The dentist had said the next thing she could give me was Clindamycin, but I have a fear of the side effects of that medicine. I already have heart problems and mild stomach issues. I have read that Clindamycin can cause severe gastrointestinal problems and arrhythmias. She also suggested Zithromax, but I have had heart palpitations while on that medication as well. I am having the teeth removed by an oral surgeon in two weeks, but am afraid of dying from infection before then. What are my options? What is the best course of action? Are there other antibiotics for this? Am I dying from the infection already? Any of your advice or help is appreciated. My other possibly relevant health history is as follows: I have high blood pressure, tachycardia, high cholesterol and mild PVC\s. I had a MRSA infection in my arm 10 years ago. I have many strep throat infections every year and frequent sinus issues. Also, I would like to mention that when I took smoothed Cephalexin capsule with a sip of water, I got a random salty taste in my mouth.
output: It is important to understand that the infection in your wisdom tooth and decayed molar can spread to other parts of your body, including your heart and brain. Therefore, it is important to take the necessary steps to prevent this from happening. The best course of action is to have the teeth removed by an oral surgeon as soon as possible. In the meantime, it is important to continue taking the Cephalexin as prescribed by your dentist. If the infection does not improve with the Cephalexin, then your dentist may consider prescribing a different antibiotic, such as Clindamycin or Zithromax. However, it is important to discuss the potential side effects of these medications with your dentist before taking them. Additionally, it is important to monitor your symptoms closely and seek medical attention if they worsen.

output: It is difficult to say why your mother's eye popped out of her eye socket without knowing the results of her medical tests. It is important that your mother follow up with her doctor to determine the cause of her eye popping out and to receive the appropriate treatment. It is 2:16 PM now and I have a few urgent questions:Should she take the morning after pill?How effective will the morning after pill be in protecting from pregnancy?How much will the pills previously taken lower the risk of pregnancy?Given her current stage of ovulation, what is the risk of her becoming pregnant? The period of time between the missed pill at 8 AM this morning and the time that she will take the morning-after pill (around 4 PM)?Do you recommend taking today's pill today if she is also taking the morning after pill today?Is there anything else we can do now to minimize the risk?Should we be worried?Thank you.
output: It is recommended that your girlfriend take the morning after pill as soon as possible. The effectiveness of the morning after pill is highest when taken within 24 hours of unprotected sex. The pills she has taken previously will lower the risk of pregnancy, but not completely eliminate it. The risk of pregnancy is highest during the time of ovulation, so there is a risk of pregnancy in this case. The period of time between the missed pill and the time she takes the morning after pill is important, as the effectiveness of the morning after pill decreases the longer it is delayed. It is recommended that she take today's pill today, even if she is taking the morning after pill. Other things you can do to minimize the risk of pregnancy include using condoms for future sexual encounters and discussing other forms of contraception with your doctor. You should be worried, but taking the morning after pill and other precautions can help reduce the risk.

input: Hello doctor,I want to lose my weight. I am very obsessed. I want to get slim. Please tell me some exercises to lose weight. Please tell me exercises that I can do anywhere without any types of equipment.
output:
There are many exercises you can do to help you lose weight without any equipment. Here are some examples:

1. Jumping jacks: Start with your feet together and your arms at your sides. Jump your feet out to the side and bring your arms up above your head. Jump back to the starting position and repeat.

2. Squats: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your arms at your sides. Bend your knees and lower your body as if you were sitting in a chair. Keep your back straight and your chest up. Push through your heels to return to the starting position.

3. Lunges: Stand with your feet hip-width apart and your arms at your sides. Step forward with one leg and lower your body until your front knee is bent at a 90-degree angle. Push through your front heel to return to the starting position.

4. Push-ups: Start in a plank position with your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart. Lower your body until your chest touches the ground. Push through your hands to return to the starting position.

5. Plank: Start in a push-up position with your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart. Lower your body until your elbows are bent at a 90-degree angle. Hold this position for 30 seconds to 1 minute.

I used a pin to pull the end out of the skin so I could tweeze the hair out, but I ended up popping the pump and pus just started oozing out. It was sore the next morning and I let it go until tonight, I tried to free the hair again and just ended up squeezing the lump, this time it was a bit larger, again blood and pus came out, but I pulled a hair out with the tweezers and I believe that it was the ingrown hair. I just noticed that my right lymph node in my neck and my groin area are swollen. I would rather not go to see my doctor. Any advice? And the tweezers and pin were both sterilized both times.
output: It is important to see a doctor if you are experiencing swollen lymph nodes. Swollen lymph nodes can be a sign of infection, and it is important to get it checked out to make sure it is not something more serious. Additionally, if you are having difficulty removing the ingrown hair, it is best to seek medical advice to ensure that it is done safely and correctly.

input: Hello doctor,I have a continuous stuffy nose which gives me brief dizzy spells that go once I try to blow my nose (not hard). It just helps equalize pressure. My glucose, BP, heart tests are normal. I eat and drink regularly. I work in a dusty environment. The dizziness is definitely associated with congestion. How can I stop it?
output: There are a few things you can do to help reduce your stuffy nose and dizziness. First, try to avoid dusty environments as much as possible. If you must be in a dusty environment, wear a face mask to help reduce your exposure. You can also try using a saline nasal spray to help clear your nasal passages. Additionally, you can try using a humidifier in your home to help keep the air moist and reduce congestion. Finally, make sure you are drinking plenty of fluids to help thin out mucus and keep your nasal passages clear. If your symptoms persist, you should see your doctor for further evaluation.

input: Hi doctor,As of now, I am suffering pain in my left rib which results in difficulty in breathing. I suspect this happens when I fall asleep on the sofa in an awkward position and when I woke up, my throat has a little pain but it did not persist but but it started to ache on the left rib part. I feel the pain towards my shoulder. It is almost about two days since I am suffering from this ache.I got breathing difficulty especially when I am lying in bed. But while standing or sitting, I just felt mild difficulty in breathing. Maybe there is an artery that has been damaged or had been under the bone. I am 24 years old.
output: It is difficult to diagnose your condition without a physical examination. I recommend that you see your doctor for a physical examination and further testing. Your doctor may order imaging tests such as an X-ray or MRI to determine the cause of your pain. Depending on the results of the tests, your doctor may recommend medications or physical therapy to help reduce your pain and improve your breathing.

input: Hi doctor,My mother is 65 years old. All her general physical parameters are normal and she is leading a normal healthy life. But, she suffers from migraine. So whenever she has migraine headache, she takes Analgin (Novalgin) medicine.Few days back, she took the Analgin and noticed swelling in her left forearm (photo attached). This swelling has occurred in past too, but this time it persists for a week along with general body pain, fatigue and mild sweating at times. BP and temperature are normal. Family doctor suggested full body check up, chest x-ray, few blood tests and thyroid test specifically. All came normal except thyroid (report attached).She did not take any medicine for the swelling yet. Please suggest what could be the cause? How can we prevent it?
output: The swelling in your mother's left forearm could be due to an allergic reaction to the Analgin (Novalgin) medication. It is possible that she is having an allergic reaction to the medication, which is causing the swelling and other symptoms. The thyroid test results suggest that she may have an underlying thyroid condition, which could be contributing to the swelling. It is important to consult with her doctor to determine the best course of action. Depending on the cause of the swelling, her doctor may recommend anti-inflammatory medications, steroids, or other medications to reduce the swelling and other symptoms. Additionally, her doctor may recommend lifestyle changes such as avoiding certain foods or activities that may trigger the swelling.

input: Hello doctor,I seem to be getting these dizzy rush sensations. They happen randomly throughout the day, but mostly when I am on the computer. It feels like an electrical pulse is surging up through the back of my head. I also feel dizzy turning side to side and when I get a headache, it feels like it is coming from deep within my left ear. It causes me to panic and get a lot of anxiety afterward. What could this electrical rush sensation be? Then, also, after I get it, I cannot look up too quickly because I feel very dizzy. It usually happens again, while typing on the computer or looking down at a smartphone.
output: This could be a symptom of a condition called benign paroxysmal positional vertigo (BPPV). BPPV is a type of vertigo that is caused by a problem with the inner ear. It is characterized by brief episodes of dizziness that are triggered by certain head movements. It is important to see a doctor to get a proper diagnosis and treatment. Treatment may include physical therapy, medications, or even surgery.

input: Hello doctor,I am having irregular periods. Shall I take kalarchikai choornam?
output: No, it is not recommended to take Kalarchikai Choornam without consulting a doctor. It is important to get a proper diagnosis of the cause of your irregular periods before taking any medication. Your doctor may recommend other treatments or medications depending on the cause of your irregular periods.

input: Hello doctor,Can a CT scan identify liver metastasis?
output: Yes, a CT scan can be used to identify liver metastasis. It is a common imaging test used to detect the spread of cancer to the liver. The CT scan can also be used to measure the size of the metastasis and to determine the best treatment options.

input: Hello doctor,I have a problem. My teeth are brittle because if I eat something hard they sometimes break or I would feel a hole developing and this is stressing me out because I have already taken out three of them and now another one is close to being totaled. Earlier today I ate something and I think it damaged them. I am tired of taking them out.
output: I'm sorry to hear that you're having this issue with your teeth. It's important to take good care of your teeth to prevent further damage. I recommend that you visit your dentist as soon as possible to get a professional opinion and treatment plan. Your dentist can assess the damage and recommend the best course of action to prevent further damage. They may also suggest a fluoride treatment or other preventive measures to help strengthen your teeth. Additionally, it's important to maintain good oral hygiene habits, such as brushing twice a day and flossing daily, to help keep your teeth healthy.

input: Hi doctor,My wife is suffering from peripartum cardiomyopathy for the past six months. She is taking beta blockers and diuretic medicine for the past four months. Her heart EF is 38 % with flat T in ECG reports. Her heart function is normal. How many days does it take to get cured?
output: Peripartum cardiomyopathy is a rare form of heart failure that occurs during the last month of pregnancy or up to five months after delivery. Unfortunately, there is no definitive timeline for recovery from this condition. Recovery depends on the severity of the condition and the individual's response to treatment. In some cases, the heart function may return to normal within a few months, while in other cases, it may take up to a year or more. It is important to follow your doctor's instructions and continue taking the prescribed medications to help improve your wife's heart function.

input: Hello doctor, My age is 23, I have undergone a surgery for bladder augmentation nine years back, since then I am doing Bicarbonate wash every week. Please suggest an alternative for this procedure.
output: There are several alternatives to bicarbonate wash for bladder augmentation. These include medications such as anticholinergics, antispasmodics, and alpha-blockers. Other treatments include electrical stimulation, botulinum toxin injections, and bladder instillation therapy. It is important to discuss these options with your doctor to determine which one is best for you.

input: Hello doctor,What is your recommendation for someone with PTSD, depression, and anxiety?
output: My recommendation for someone with PTSD, depression, and anxiety is to seek professional help from a mental health professional. A mental health professional can provide evidence-based treatments such as cognitive-behavioral therapy (CBT), exposure therapy, and/or medication management. Additionally, it is important to practice self-care, such as engaging in regular physical activity, eating a balanced diet, getting enough sleep, and engaging in activities that bring joy. It is also important to reach out to supportive family and friends for help and to build a strong support system.

input: Hello doctor,I am a 20-year-old boy. I am very thin. I want to gain weight in short span of time. Is there any ayurvedic medicine for this?
output: Ayurvedic medicine can be a great option for weight gain. Some of the most commonly used herbs for weight gain are Ashwagandha, Shatavari, Amalaki, Gokshura, Vidari, and Guduchi. These herbs can be taken in the form of powder, capsules, or decoction. Additionally, you should also focus on eating a balanced diet with plenty of proteins, healthy fats, and complex carbohydrates. Exercise regularly and get enough rest to ensure that your body is able to absorb the nutrients from the food you eat.

input: Hello doctor,My 37-year-old wife is 14 weeks pregnant with my second child. Her level one scan is normal and the double marker is also fine. But, the doctor has told to get DNA test that is an NIPT test. Is it important? If level 1 and the double marker are fine then DNA and NIPT test should also be fine right?
output: It is important to get the NIPT test done, even if the level 1 scan and double marker tests are normal. The NIPT test is a non-invasive prenatal test that can detect chromosomal abnormalities in the fetus. It is a more accurate test than the level 1 scan and double marker tests, and can provide more detailed information about the health of the fetus. Therefore, it is important to get the NIPT test done to ensure that the fetus is healthy.

input: Hello doctor,I was suffering from minor Achilles tendinopathy and visited a physiotherapist today to get it checked. During the session, he performed some deep tissue massage on the calf (which was very tight) to relax it, which was very painful. After the massage, I experienced sharp pains while walking (which was not there beforehand), and when I brought this up with the physio, he said it was normal because it was the first time I had gotten deep tissue massage on that area.I have been icing the calf and resting, and while it has gotten a little better, it still hurts to walk. I have my exams tomorrow which I have to get to and other events on the weekend where I have to be (and will involve walking). I am worried about how I can see as I cannot walk at all. Is it normal to experience such pain after deep tissue massage to tight calf muscles, or did I sustain some injury (say a muscle strain or something similar) and need to get it checked out?
output: It is normal to experience some pain after deep tissue massage, especially if the muscles were very tight. However, if the pain persists or worsens, it is important to get it checked out by a doctor or physiotherapist. It is possible that you may have sustained a muscle strain or other injury, and it is important to get it checked out to ensure that it is not something more serious. In the meantime, you should continue to rest and ice the area, and take any pain medications as prescribed by your doctor.

input: Hello doctor,Approximately one week ago, I had my wisdom teeth removed. On my lower left, I have a dry socket, which I am getting treated for via packing (at least I think that is what it is called). On the right side, healing is just fine, however, I noticed some white stuff lodged in the gum. I am not sure if it is food or scar tissue because when I tried to get it out with a toothpick, it did not come out very easily, so I left it alone. Is this food or scar tissue? It is mildly bothersome.I brush my teeth but know to be careful around the surgical sites so they do not get irritated. It seems like a lot of plaque builds up back there because of this, and I am not quite sure what to do. Also, there is a very small spot of red gums on the front side of my second molar. I put a bit of mouthwash on it with a toothpick and left it alone.I have two questions, what is the whitish stuff that feels like food trapped in my healing gum socket? And what is this small patch of irritated gum on my second molar? Any help is appreciated.I am currently on Celexa (for depression), 600 mg of Ibuprofen (for wisdom tooth pain).
output: The white stuff that you are feeling in your gum is likely scar tissue. Scar tissue is a normal part of the healing process after wisdom teeth removal and can take several weeks to fully form. It is important to be gentle when brushing around the surgical sites to avoid irritating the area. The small patch of red gums on your second molar could be caused by a number of things, including irritation from brushing too hard or an infection. If the area does not improve with gentle brushing and rinsing with an antiseptic mouthwash, it is best to have it checked out by your dentist. Ibuprofen is an effective pain reliever for wisdom tooth pain, but it is important to take it as directed and not exceed the recommended dosage.

input: Hi doctor,I am 22 years old. I have a problem of hair fall. My hairs fall so quickly, and there is no regrowth of hairs. Please help.
output: Hair loss can be caused by a variety of factors, including genetics, hormones, stress, diet, and certain medications. It is important to identify the underlying cause of your hair loss in order to determine the best treatment plan. I recommend that you see a dermatologist for a full evaluation. They can help you determine the cause of your hair loss and recommend the best treatment options for you.

I am having these symptoms for the past four to five months. I am not taking medications. I have tried Neurontin with a low dose of 100 mg taken twice daily for two weeks. But I stopped it because of its side effects, and it does not relieve my symptoms. I had shaking episodes of anxiety and worried that I might have contracted herpes 2. I have tested for all the common STDs which showed a negative result except herpes simplex showing a positive outcome.I am also experiencing impotence. I had undergone a hernia operation with a net before 11 years. Also, I had undergone a small hernia surgery on my right side which is not very visible. I have wandering pain around my lower abdomen and groin. Often it is hard to distinguish where the pain gets originated. Sometimes, it involves both upper and inner thigh in the vicinity of the testes sack. I have tenderness and minor swelling in my testis and epididymis. I have difficulty in erection.
output: It is important that you see a doctor for a physical examination and further testing. Your symptoms could be due to a variety of causes, including an infection, hernia, or a nerve issue. Your doctor can help determine the cause of your symptoms and provide appropriate treatment. input: Hello doctor,I just recently started urinating blood when I go to the restroom. I have a constant urge to urine and I have no idea why out of the blue this is happening. I am a male, 36 years old, 6'2", 190 lbs. I have no medical issues or past history of kidney problems or cancer. Can it be due to STD?

input: Hello doctor,My foreskin of the penis is tight. Is there any problem in the future during sex? My age is 20 years, male, and single.

input: Hello doctor,I have minor beta thalassemia which I got from my mother, but unlike her (asymptomatic), I have anemia symptoms like paleness, shortness of breath after the least effort, feeling tired all the time, broken nails and I want to know if it could be due to lack of iron? Could people with minor beta thalassemia also get iron deficiency anemia? Knowing that I get heavy cycles and my diet is very poor.
output: Yes, people with minor beta thalassemia can also get iron deficiency anemia. This is because beta thalassemia can cause an increased need for iron, which can lead to iron deficiency anemia if not met. Additionally, heavy menstrual cycles can also contribute to iron deficiency anemia. It is important to make sure that you are eating a balanced diet that is rich in iron, as well as taking iron supplements if necessary.

input: Hello doctor,I am of 21 and I am suffering from permanent blurry eye vision in my only right one. It is by birth. Is there any chance to cure it without any permanent glasses and without any operations. Suggest me, please.
output: Unfortunately, there is no known cure for permanent blurry vision in one eye without glasses or surgery. The best way to manage this condition is to wear corrective lenses, such as glasses or contact lenses, to improve your vision. If you are not comfortable with wearing glasses or contact lenses, you may want to consider laser eye surgery, which can correct your vision and reduce the need for glasses or contact lenses. However, it is important to speak to an eye doctor to determine if this is the best option for you.

input: Hello doctor,I saw these lesions on my scrotum and outer genitals yesterday. I am currently on day 6 of chicken pox. What could these lesions possibly be from? Is this an STD?

Took six different brands, etc. Pregnancy tests are all negative. What could be causing this late period? I am under a lot of stress also.

It is also possible that you may have an underlying medical condition that is causing the delay. input: Hello doctor,I am a 27-year-old female. I have been on Depo-Provera for six years. I am not taking any other medications. Lately, I have been experiencing severe mood swings and have not been myself. One minute I am dancing around the room and could not be happier, the next I am either crying or very angry. Normally, I do not cry and I am usually pretty laid back. I have also been getting dizzy mostly when I stand up or walk up the stairs. I have trouble sleeping and or sleeping too much. I am hungry all the time, however, when I do eat I feel nausea. I have done some research and have found that these symptoms are both common with the injection and also with pregnancy. How do I tell, if these are pregnancy symptoms or if it is because of the Depo shot? I did miss my last shot three months ago. Last month I took a home pregnancy test it came back negative. Will a home test be enough to tell if I am pregnant or not?
output: It is possible that your symptoms could be related to the Depo-Provera injection, but it is also possible that you could be pregnant. The best way to determine if you are pregnant is to take a blood test. This will be more accurate than a home pregnancy test. If the test is negative, then it is likely that your symptoms are related to the Depo-Provera injection. If you are concerned about your symptoms, it is best to speak to your doctor for further advice.

input: Hello doctor,I had stomach pain after which my report was confirmed as gallbladder stones. What is the further procedure? Please let me know all the details, including the cost.
output: The further procedure for gallbladder stones depends on the size and number of stones present. If the stones are small, your doctor may recommend a low-fat diet and medications to help dissolve the stones. If the stones are large, your doctor may recommend a procedure called cholecystectomy, which is the surgical removal of the gallbladder. The cost of the procedure will depend on the type of procedure and the hospital or clinic where it is performed. Your doctor can provide you with more information about the cost.

input: Hello doctor,My 24 days newborn son is suffering from midgut malrotation. Is this a problem?
output: Yes, midgut malrotation is a problem that can cause serious complications in newborns. It is a condition in which the intestines are not properly positioned in the abdomen. It can cause blockages in the intestines, leading to abdominal pain, vomiting, and other symptoms. If left untreated, it can lead to serious complications, such as infection, perforation of the intestines, and even death. It is important to seek medical attention right away if you suspect your baby may have midgut malrotation.

input: Hello doctor,Obstructive jaundice has been detected. ERCP was done. Serum bilirubin still very high. MRCP report says everything is alright but neither serum bilirubin nor yellowness has got less.

It is important to follow up with your doctor to determine the cause of the obstruction and to determine the best course of treatment. Your doctor may recommend additional tests or treatments to help resolve the obstruction and reduce your bilirubin levels.

input: Hello doctor,I am 28 years old. From the past two weeks, there is a slight pain in my right ear. I tried Clear Wax ear drops and normal ear drops then there is a relief for a certain period then again mild pain is coming the next day. When I wake up in the morning there is a very slight headache kind on the right side and some sort of discomfort in my right ear. There is not severe pain but certainly, there is some sort of mild pain. I also noticed whenever I tried using earbuds in my left ear to clean then I am getting cough as if some sort of itchiness sensation in the ear is causing immediate cough in the throat and normal again after I take earbud out. I want to know whether I should consult ENT specialist immediately or if there are any ear drops in particular to use before I go to ENT doctor.
output: It is best to consult an ENT specialist as soon as possible. The specialist will be able to examine your ear and determine the cause of your symptoms. They may recommend specific ear drops or other treatments to help relieve your symptoms. In the meantime, you can try using over-the-counter ear drops to help reduce the pain and discomfort. If the symptoms persist or worsen, it is important to seek medical attention.

input: Hi doctor,I had a month old twin baby girls. They were born in the 34th week of pregnancy. One baby was 2.2 Kg, and the other was a little weaker weighing 2 Kg. Since there is not enough mother\s milk after several attempts, I had to go for artificial milk powder. Initially, as suggested by the hospital pediatrician, they were given Dexolac Special Care, but after 20th day when their weight was around 2.4 Kg, they were given to Dexolac Premium 1. Out of the 2 babies, the weaker baby is responding well and quickly gaining weight (taking around 75 ml milk every 3 hours). But the baby which was born stronger is not drinking sufficient milk (45 ml in one feed, at an interval of around 3 hours), and is taking around an hour to take one feed. Also, she is having issues of gas and constipation. Because of constipation, she keeps crying. Now, this baby is not gaining weight and seem to be weaker. Please suggest what we can do in this case and shall we switch her milk to Lactogen or some other company?
output: It is great that your baby is responding well to the Dexolac Special Care formula. However, it is important to note that the Dexolac Premium 1 formula is not suitable for babies under 6 months of age. Therefore, it is best to switch your baby back to the Dexolac Special Care formula. If your baby is still having issues with gas and constipation, you may want to consider switching to a different formula such as Lactogen or another brand. It is important to consult with your pediatrician before making any changes to your baby's formula. Your pediatrician can also provide advice on how to help your baby with her gas and constipation issues.

input: Hello doctor,I am 24 years old. I am married. I have a bit problem in my sexual life. Whenever I insert my penis in her vagina she told me that when I insert full penis in her she feels pain. Is it normal or not?
output: It is not normal for your partner to experience pain when you insert your penis into her vagina. It is possible that she may have an infection or other medical condition that is causing the pain. It is important that you both see a doctor to get a proper diagnosis and treatment.

input: Hello doctor,I am 7 weeks pregnant and I want to terminate it. Please suggest me some natural methods.
output: Unfortunately, there are no natural methods that can be used to terminate a pregnancy. If you are considering terminating your pregnancy, please consult with a medical professional to discuss your options.

input: Hi doctor,I went for an annual health checkup and found there was a minor change in the ECG. I am 28 years old. My weight is 80 kg and height is 163 cm. My BMI is 30 and waist circumference is 90. My BP 130/90 mmHg. I am also attaching my ECG report to you. I need your suggestion. Thank you.
output: It is difficult to provide a suggestion without seeing the ECG report. However, it is important to note that any changes in the ECG should be discussed with your doctor. Your doctor may recommend further tests or treatments depending on the results of the ECG. It is also important to maintain a healthy lifestyle, including a balanced diet and regular exercise, to help keep your heart healthy.

input: Hello doctor, My baby is 5 months old. I have given vaccine to her on 18th of this month, since then she was having fever every four hours the other day too. After that she is not drinking breastmilk and formula too. Now only drinks at night time while sleeping. What should I do?
output: It is possible that your baby is having a reaction to the vaccine. It is important to monitor her temperature and make sure that it does not get too high. If it does, you should contact your pediatrician. You should also make sure that she is getting enough fluids, even if she is not drinking breastmilk or formula. You can try offering her other fluids such as water, juice, or electrolyte drinks. If she is still not drinking, you should contact your pediatrician for further advice.

input: Hello doctor,I am a 61 year old female and a diabetic for the last ten years. I had a cystocele repair surgery along with hysterectomy and cervix and ovaries removal five months ago. There is a slight discharge on and off. I did a urine culture now and found that there was a colony of Enterococcus faecalis. Please let me know if this is serious and whether I have to take a course of antibiotics for it. I do not have any symptoms of UTI or abscess etc. Also, the cystocele repair was not a success as the bladder is still at the mouth of the vagina. Please also let me know if anything can be done to put the bladder back in place. If this is not done, what are the repercussions?
output:
Enterococcus faecalis is a type of bacteria that is commonly found in the human body. It is usually harmless, but can cause infections in certain situations. In your case, it is likely that the bacteria is present due to the surgery you had five months ago. It is possible that the bacteria is causing a slight discharge, but it is not likely to be serious. If you are not experiencing any other symptoms of a urinary tract infection or abscess, then it is likely that the bacteria is not causing any harm.

If you are concerned about the presence of the bacteria, you can speak to your doctor about taking a course of antibiotics. However, it is important to note that antibiotics can have side effects and should only be taken when absolutely necessary.

In regards to the cystocele repair, it is possible that the bladder is still at the mouth of the vagina due to scar tissue or other factors. If this is the case, your doctor may be able to perform a revision surgery to reposition the bladder. The repercussions of not having the surgery are that the bladder may not be able to empty properly, which can lead to urinary incontinence and other complications.

input: Hi doctor,I have been with the same partner for 8 years now. During these all 8 years I have had several UTIs with some leading to severe kidney infections. Last week after almost two years of not having a UTI I felt the horrible symptoms again. When going to the doctors UTI urine test came back positive. The doctor prescribed me seven days Nitrofurantoin antibiotics which cleared the pain and seemed gone entirely. Unfortunately two days later, the symptoms came back (please note that I had sex with my partner the day before) with burning sensation when urinating and painful when standing with the need to go toilet every 2 to 3 minutes. I went back to the clinic the same day to get it checked and take more antibiotics.But to my surprise, the urine test came back clear for UTI, and my symptoms disappeared. Then the doctor advised me to get tested for Chlamydia as the symptoms can sometimes be mistaken to be UTI. I have been diagnosed with Chlamydia at the beginning of this same relationship and was treated for it. My partner was also tested, but his results came back negative. Is it possible that the treatment that I had for Chlamydia 8 years ago did not clear it entirely and this lead to several UTIs and kidney infections? And also, would the antibiotics for UTI clear Chlamydia? Thank you in advance for your help.
output: It is possible that the treatment you had for Chlamydia 8 years ago did not clear it entirely and this could have led to several UTIs and kidney infections. However, it is also possible that the UTIs and kidney infections were caused by other factors, such as a weakened immune system or poor hygiene. It is also possible that the antibiotics for UTI did not clear the Chlamydia, as different antibiotics are used to treat different infections. It is important to get tested for Chlamydia again to confirm the diagnosis and to ensure that you and your partner are both treated appropriately.

input: Hello doctor,I am 42 years old and have been diagnosed with multiple uterine fibroids. Two of them are a little more than 3 cm at different places in the uterus. In the past, I have been operated for endometriosis level 4. As usual, the gynecologist is suggesting a hysterectomy. But since I am in my perimenopausal phase, can the fibroids shrink with medication? I have been suggested Fibroease.

Fibroease is a natural supplement that may help reduce the size of fibroids, but it is not a guaranteed treatment. It is important to discuss all of your options with your gynecologist to determine the best course of action for you.

input: Hello doctor,My daughter is 18 months of age. She was born at 38 weeks due to placenta failure and oxygen issues. She was 5 lbs 10 ounces at birth and was healthy (did not have to stay in the NICU). She hit all of her milestones in terms of rolling over, crawling and walking (walked at 14.5 months), but is a toe walker. Her left leg (to us) is weaker than her right and her left leg does not bend as much as her right leg. She began to speak around 10 months of age then her speech left. Her non-verbal communication is good. She responds to her name but not always. She is beginning to learn more of what we are saying, she plays with some toys, is not terribly social. We are thinking that she may be on the autism spectrum and we have an evaluation soon to determine that. But my question is, could this be cerebral palsy?
output: It is possible that your daughter may have cerebral palsy, however, it is difficult to make a diagnosis without a full evaluation. The evaluation you are having done should help to determine if your daughter has any developmental delays or disabilities, including cerebral palsy. It is important to remember that cerebral palsy is a broad term that encompasses a range of physical and cognitive impairments, so it is important to get a full evaluation to determine the exact diagnosis.

input: Hi doctor,I have a generic query. Can we trust the NABL and CAP accreditation laboratories in terms of reliability and accuracy? And what does they mean? And all NABL and CAP labs are of same quality? Please explain in detail.

The standards set by these organizations ensure that the laboratories are reliable and accurate in their testing and calibration.

input: Hello doctor,How eating habits or certain foods impact sleep? How much should men be stretching at 25, 30, 35, 40, 45? Does the need to be flexible vary by age?

The amount of stretching that men should do at each age varies depending on their activity level and fitness goals. Generally, men should aim to do at least 10 minutes of stretching per day. This should include dynamic stretching, which involves moving the body through a range of motion, as well as static stretching, which involves holding a stretch for a period of time. As men age, they may need to increase the amount of stretching they do to maintain flexibility and reduce the risk of injury.

input: Hi doctor,I am in my late 6th month pregnancy. Recently I went for a scan named targeted imaging for fetal anomalies (TIFFA). All the reports were normal except hypoplastic nasal bone and higher normal values of amniotic fluid. I am approaching you for second consultation now. How much safe it is to go for amniocentesis test? Is there any alternate test to get better results? I decided not to have a baby who is mentally retarded. Please suggest me your valuable advice.
output:
It is important to understand that the TIFFA scan is not a diagnostic test for Down's Syndrome. It is only a screening test that can indicate the possibility of Down's Syndrome. If the results of the TIFFA scan are concerning, then it is recommended to proceed with a genetic amniocentesis test to confirm the diagnosis. 

If the results of the amniocentesis test are positive for Down's Syndrome, then you can decide whether or not to terminate the pregnancy. It is important to understand that the decision to terminate a pregnancy is a very personal one and should be made after careful consideration. 

The amniocentesis test is generally considered to be safe, but there is a small risk of miscarriage associated with the procedure. It is important to discuss the risks and benefits of the procedure with your doctor before proceeding. 

There are other tests that can be used to screen for Down's Syndrome, such as chorionic villus sampling (CVS) and non-invasive prenatal testing (NIPT). However, these tests are not as accurate as amniocentesis and may not provide definitive results. 

It is important to remember that the decision to terminate a pregnancy is a very personal one and should be made after careful consideration. It is also important to seek out support from family and friends during this difficult time.

Hello,

Thank you for your question. The semen analysis report you have provided is a good overview of the quality of your semen. The liquefaction time of 30 minutes is within the normal range, as is the duration of abstinence of four days. The appearance of creamy white is also normal. The motility of 100% is excellent, with 20% of the sperm being rapid, 10% being slow, 5% being non-progressive, and 83% being immotile. The vitality count of 15 million is also within the normal range. The morphology of 20% normal and 80% abnormal is slightly lower than the normal range of 30-50%, but is still considered normal.

Overall, your semen analysis report is within the normal range, which is a good sign. If you have any further questions or concerns, please do not hesitate to reach out to your doctor.

input: Hello doctor,I am seeking experts to comment on low-carb diets.What is the complete macronutrient breakdown for a typical low-carb diet? How much fat should you eat on a low-carb diet? How much protein should you eat on a low-carb diet?We are looking for suggestions on vegan foods for energy. Name the foods you are recommending and set description as to why you are suggesting this food.
output:
A typical low-carb diet consists of a macronutrient breakdown of approximately 60-75% fat, 15-30% protein, and 5-10% carbohydrates. The amount of fat you should eat on a low-carb diet will depend on your individual needs and goals, but it is generally recommended to get at least 50-60% of your daily calories from fat. The amount of protein you should eat on a low-carb diet will also depend on your individual needs and goals, but it is generally recommended to get at least 15-20% of your daily calories from protein.

For vegan foods that provide energy, I would recommend:

-Whole grains: Whole grains such as oats, quinoa, and brown rice are packed with complex carbohydrates that provide sustained energy throughout the day.

-Legumes: Legumes such as beans, lentils, and chickpeas are a great source of plant-based protein and fiber, which can help keep you feeling full and energized.

-Nuts and seeds: Nuts and seeds such as almonds, walnuts, and chia seeds are a great source of healthy fats and protein, which can help provide long-lasting energy.

-Fruits and vegetables: Fruits and vegetables are packed with vitamins, minerals, and antioxidants that can help boost energy levels.

-Smoothies: Smoothies are a great way to get a variety of nutrients in one meal, and can be made with a variety of fruits, vegetables, nuts, and seeds.

What do I need to do?I am eating healthy and getting good sleep but I am not losing weight. My vitamin D level is 40ng/ml and I am taking vitamin B12. I am taking vitamin D for almost one year. I m taking 4000 IU for five days a week. Please explain in detail the treatment plan.
output:
It is difficult to determine the cause of your body pain without a physical examination and further testing. However, it is important to note that this is not a definitive diagnosis and further testing is needed to confirm this. It is also possible that your body pain could be caused by other conditions such as fibromyalgia, chronic fatigue syndrome, or even a vitamin deficiency. 

Your doctor may recommend further testing such as an X-ray, MRI, or ultrasound to determine the cause of your body pain. Additionally, they may recommend a referral to a rheumatologist for further evaluation and treatment. 

In terms of treatment, your doctor may recommend lifestyle modifications such as regular exercise, a healthy diet, and stress management. They may also recommend medications such as non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs) or corticosteroids to reduce inflammation and pain. Additionally, they may recommend physical therapy to help strengthen your muscles and improve your range of motion. 

Finally, it is important to note that vitamin D supplementation can help improve your vitamin D levels, but it is important to speak to your doctor before taking any supplements.

input: Hi doctor,My chief complaint is severe lower back pain and pain in upper thighs. My medical history is as follows. Before three years, I had FNAC which showed invasive ductal carcinoma, right breast ER+, PR+, Hercep score "0." Last month, I had an x-ray and MRI, which showed focal altered marrow intensity lesions seen in B/L pelvic bone, sacrum, and left upper femoral shaft consistent with metastasis. I also had a PET scan which showed metabolically active ill-defined lytic destructive lesions in post cortex shaft of left femur, right inferior pubic ramus, B/L iliac bones, sacrum, D5, 7, 11 and L1, 4, sternum, right 3, 5, 7 post ribs with mid-right paravertebral soft tissue lesion at D7 level likely metastasis.
output: Based on your medical history and investigations, it is likely that you have metastatic breast cancer. Metastatic breast cancer is cancer that has spread from the breast to other parts of the body, such as the bones, lungs, liver, or brain. The lower back pain and pain in the upper thighs that you are experiencing are likely due to the metastatic lesions in your pelvic bone, sacrum, and left upper femoral shaft. It is important that you follow up with your doctor for further evaluation and treatment. Your doctor may recommend additional imaging tests, such as a CT scan or bone scan, to better assess the extent of the metastasis. Treatment for metastatic breast cancer may include chemotherapy, hormone therapy, targeted therapy, or radiation therapy. Your doctor will be able to discuss the best treatment options for you based on your individual case.

input: Hello doctor,I am a 23-year-old male. I have no symptoms and I am not taking any current medication. What more should be done?
output: It is normal for heart rate to vary from person to person, and it is also normal for heart rate to increase with physical activity or stress. It is important to note that a heart rate of 98 is still within the normal range. However, if you or your girlfriend are still concerned, it may be a good idea to speak to your doctor about further testing. Your doctor may recommend an electrocardiogram (ECG) or other tests to check for any underlying heart conditions. Additionally, it is important to maintain a healthy lifestyle, including eating a balanced diet, exercising regularly, and avoiding smoking and excessive alcohol consumption.

input: Hi doctor,Please explain about the causes of the IBS. How can it be managed? Please advice.
output:
IBS (Irritable Bowel Syndrome) is a common disorder that affects the large intestine. It is characterized by abdominal pain, cramping, bloating, gas, diarrhea, and constipation. The exact cause of IBS is unknown, but it is believed to be related to a combination of factors, including abnormal muscle contractions in the intestine, changes in the balance of bacteria in the gut, food sensitivities, stress, and hormones.

IBS can be managed through lifestyle changes, such as eating a healthy diet, avoiding trigger foods, exercising regularly, and managing stress. Medications may also be prescribed to help reduce symptoms. Probiotics, fiber supplements, and antispasmodic medications may also be recommended.

input: Hi doctor,I am a 19 year old girl. When I was 15 years old, I watched a romantic movie which caused my problem, since then I made an imaginary life with an imaginary man in my mind. I have got involved with this problem for years. When I was a child, I had difficulties which I could not solve at that time, so I started fantasizing and tried not to involve myself in real life\s problem. But then, there was no love in my imagination, I was a very happy successful girl, and I was a famous, respectful person.But after I got defeated at a state level game, I understood that I am not intelligent enough to achieve such goals, I was so depressed with no enthusiasm in studying. I got to know about sex and intercourse, I was confused and hated my gender, I thought of changing my gender. I had depression, and I was so disappointed about life. Then I started to imagine a man who lived with me, and I loved him so much. Instead of facing my life problems, I used to fantasize about him. From last year I have imaginary sex with him.The problem I have is that my life is interrupted by my imagination. I cannot deal with other students, especially boys. I have lost my confidence, do not have the enthusiasm to study. I cannot focus when I am in the class, and I do not take any efforts to solve my problem. I just keep imaging a peaceful life with no problems, sometimes when I cannot control my anxiety and stress, I start having sex in my mind. I do not know what to do, and I want to stop this imaginary life. How do I stop this imaginary life and love? I know this man is not real, and whenever my imaginary life becomes sad, it has an influence on my real life. I currently take tablet Levebel 500 mg, two tablets a day.
output:
It sounds like you have been struggling with this problem for a long time and it is having a significant impact on your life. It is understandable that you feel embarrassed to talk about this issue with a psychologist, but it is important to remember that they are there to help you and that they have heard many stories like yours before. It is also important to remember that you are not alone in this and that there are many people who have experienced similar issues.

The first step in addressing this issue is to talk to a mental health professional about it. They can help you to understand why you have been engaging in this behavior and can provide you with strategies to help you cope with it. They can also help you to identify any underlying issues that may be contributing to your behavior and can provide you with the necessary support and guidance to help you move forward.

In addition to talking to a mental health professional, it is important to focus on developing healthy coping strategies. This can include engaging in activities that help to reduce stress and anxiety, such as exercise, yoga, meditation, and journaling. It can also include engaging in activities that help to increase your self-esteem and confidence, such as volunteering, taking classes, or engaging in creative activities.

Finally, it is important to remember that it is possible to overcome this issue and to move forward with your life. With the right support and guidance, you can learn to manage your thoughts and feelings in a healthier way and to focus on the positive aspects of your life.

input: Hello doctor,My right side jaw is paining while having food. On consultation, I was advised for physiotherapy. What could be the reason for it?

input: Hi doctor,I am a 19-year-old female. I lost my virginity about 10 months ago with my boyfriend. Now after 10 months has passed I found out that I have two warts inside my vagina. But in my opinion, I think it is quite big. So the doctor gave me a prescription for Condyline paint which he told me to use for three days only per week and I have to keep using it for three weeks and if it does not get better he told me to see him again. Now I have a few questions. Is this mean I have an HPV virus inside my body? How can I make the virus go away permanently? Will Gardasil injection make it go away? If it does not go away permanently, how can I make sure that I have no HPV viruses and so these warts will not come back again? Is this mean that I have this HPV from my boyfriend? How to use Condyline paint correctly? I wash my vagina blades and use the cotton pads to dry it, then I use start to use the Condyline paint. I only dip the swab once into the reagent and then I open my vagina blades so that I am able to paint the two warts inside my vagina as much as I can. Then I paint it all over the very tiny warts in the vagina blades area. Am I doing it correctly?Now I have been using the Condyline for two days, but the very tiny warts that are around the vagina blades started to grow more. Is this mean anything? Can condoms prevent these HPV viruses? If I break up with my boyfriend, will this help my symptoms and health to become better? I am very scared of whether this can leads to cancer? I do not want this to ever happen to me again, how can I prevent this to happen again?If my warts are gone can I have sex with my boyfriend? Will these symptoms comeback again? If I decided to buy the Gardasil injection and injected it now, then the next after two months, then next after six months, but during this time can I have sex with my boy friend? Will the vaccine still work?
output: It is possible that you have an HPV virus, but it is not possible to know for sure without further testing. The Condyline paint should help to reduce the size of the warts, but it is not a cure for HPV. Gardasil is a vaccine that can help to prevent HPV infection, but it will not help to treat existing warts. Condoms can help to reduce the risk of HPV transmission, but they are not 100% effective. If you break up with your boyfriend, it may help to reduce your risk of HPV transmission, but it is not a guarantee. It is unlikely that your warts will lead to cancer, but it is important to monitor them and see your doctor if they do not improve with treatment. You should use the Condyline paint as directed by your doctor. You should not have sex with your boyfriend until the warts have been treated and cleared up. The Gardasil vaccine will still work if you have sex during the course of the treatment, but it is important to use condoms to reduce the risk of transmission.

input: Hi doctor,I am a 49-year-old woman and last month I was hospitalized with a necrotizing soft tissue infection on my thigh. I had two debridement surgeries and was discharged after 5 days. I was told that the infection was not MRSA, but a "slower moving bacteria" they did not tell me what it was. I was swabbed for MRSA in my nose and butt before both surgeries and was told I did not have it. For the last day of my stay, I had a roommate who had a bad MRSA infection on her butt and sometimes had diarrhea incontinence during dressing changes. I had no physical contact with her, but we had the same nurse. I was discharged with a five day course of Augmentin.The wound has been healing very well and has not gotten infected, but three weeks after discharge I got an abscess under my arm. I went to an urgent care and was prescribed Clindamycin and told to return in three days for drainage. The abscess did not improve or get worse over the three days. I got it drained and was prescribed Augmentin and told to also continue the clindamycin. That was a week ago and the wound is healing well. They called today and said cultures show it was MRSA and they prescribed Bactrim and told me to stop the other antibiotics.I am feeling devastated by this and wanting to understand why it happened. Could I have gotten it in the hospital? I am concerned that it will not go away. Are those swabs at the hospital conclusive and mean for sure I did not have MRSA a month ago? I have never had any medical problems before and these experiences have been very frightening. Is there anything else I can do to prevent recurrence? I have read about everything from bleach baths and hibiclens to antibiotics in the nose.
output:
It is possible that you could have acquired the MRSA infection in the hospital, although it is difficult to say for sure. The swabs taken at the hospital are not always 100% conclusive, so it is possible that you could have had MRSA at the time of your hospital stay and it was not detected. It is also possible that you acquired the infection after your hospital stay. 

To prevent recurrence, it is important to practice good hygiene, such as washing your hands frequently and avoiding contact with people who have active infections. You can also use an antiseptic soap, such as Hibiclens, to help reduce the risk of infection. Additionally, you may want to consider taking an antibiotic, such as Bactrim, for a few weeks to help prevent recurrence. It is also important to follow up with your doctor regularly to monitor your progress.

However, it is important to remember that the risk of developing cancer from a CT scan is very small. The radiation dose from a CT scan is much lower than the natural background radiation that we are exposed to on a daily basis. Additionally, the benefit of the CT scan in helping to diagnose and treat your condition far outweighs the potential risks. If you are still concerned, you can speak to your doctor about the risks and benefits of the CT scan and discuss any other options that may be available.

input: Hello doctor,I often have elbow pain due to spending more time with computer and using a mouse or keyboard. I work 7 to 8 hours daily in computer and pain is gradually increasing. The pain earlier used to reduce by taking Voveran tablet and using Voveran gel. The pain has become frequent now and I am taking Tendoshot capsule for the last few days. output:
It is important to take a break from using the computer every hour or so to reduce the strain on your elbows. You should also make sure that your posture is correct when using the computer. Taking regular breaks and stretching your arms and wrists can also help reduce the strain on your elbows.

In terms of treatment, it is best to consult with your doctor to determine the best course of action. Depending on the severity of your pain, your doctor may recommend taking a non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) such as ibuprofen or naproxen. Your doctor may also recommend physical therapy or other treatments to help reduce the pain.

Using a tennis elbow strap or sleeve can help reduce the strain on your elbows and provide some relief. However, it is important to note that these are not a cure and should be used in conjunction with other treatments.

Finally, it is important to take steps to prevent elbow pain while using the computer. This includes making sure that your posture is correct, taking regular breaks, and stretching your arms and wrists. Additionally, using a wrist rest and an ergonomic mouse can help reduce the strain on your elbows.

It is difficult to predict how serious your elbow pain may become in the future. However, taking steps to reduce the strain on your elbows and seeking treatment from your doctor can help reduce the risk of further pain and injury.

input: Hi doctor,What is the difference between IntraLasik and Contoura Lasik?

This procedure is more precise than traditional LASIK and IntraLasik, and can provide better vision results.

input: Hi doctor,My nephew is a premature baby. On the third day, his blood glucose level was decreased to 34. Later, he was admitted and kept under surveillance. His blood test revealed elevated bilirubin level. Four days later, his blood values become normal. On the same day, suddenly there was swelling on his body. The biochemistry examination revealed urine spot protein to creatinine ratio 2.19 and moderate grade proteinuria.
output: It sounds like your nephew is having a complication of prematurity called nephrotic syndrome. This is a condition in which the kidneys are not able to filter proteins properly, leading to proteinuria (high levels of protein in the urine) and swelling. The elevated bilirubin level is likely due to the breakdown of red blood cells, which can occur in nephrotic syndrome. Treatment for nephrotic syndrome typically includes medications to reduce inflammation and swelling, as well as medications to reduce proteinuria. Your nephew's doctor will be able to provide more information about the best treatment plan for him.

input: Hello doctor,Why some men cannot grow full beards? Explain why some men are not capable of growing full beards, and can only manage thin, patchy ones. Is this due to testosterone and genetics or something more? How does not being able to grow a full beard potentially impact men psychologically? Can this be emasculating for men or cause issues with self-esteem? Is there anything patchy men can do?
output:
The ability to grow a full beard is largely determined by genetics and testosterone levels. Men with lower levels of testosterone or certain genetic traits may not be able to grow a full beard, and instead may only be able to grow a thin, patchy beard. This can be a source of frustration and low self-esteem for some men, as a full beard is often seen as a sign of masculinity.

There are a few things that patchy men can do to help improve the appearance of their beard. First, they can use a beard trimmer to even out the length of the beard and make it look more uniform. Second, they can use a beard oil or balm to help soften and condition the beard, making it look fuller and healthier. Finally, they can use a beard brush to help distribute the natural oils in the beard and make it look thicker.

Ultimately, it is important for men to remember that the ability to grow a full beard is largely out of their control, and that there is nothing wrong with having a patchy beard. With the right care and maintenance, patchy beards can look just as good as full beards.

input: Hi doctor,My mother got a sudden heart pain. I took her to the hospital. After ECG And further processing, we came to know that she got ischemic heart disease and her two valves of the heart are closed. She has diabetes and blood pressure problems due to which atherosclerosis occurred three days ago. The doctor told him for angiography. Are angiography and stent good for her? Please also tell me about everything related to heart problems cure and heart diet.
output:
Angiography is a procedure used to diagnose and treat certain heart conditions. It involves inserting a thin tube (catheter) into a blood vessel in the arm or leg and guiding it to the heart with the help of X-ray imaging. The catheter is then used to inject a special dye into the coronary arteries, which allows the doctor to see the arteries on an X-ray. If a blockage is found, a stent may be placed to open the artery and improve blood flow.

As for diet, it is important to maintain a healthy diet to help manage heart disease. This includes eating a variety of fruits and vegetables, whole grains, lean proteins, and healthy fats. It is also important to limit sodium, saturated fat, and added sugars. Additionally, it is important to stay active and maintain a healthy weight.

It is important to speak with your mother's doctor to determine the best course of treatment for her specific condition.

output:
Based on the information you have provided, it appears that you have some elevated levels of certain markers in your blood and urine tests. Your elevated uric acid, cholesterol, triglycerides, and VLDL levels may indicate that you are at risk for developing cardiovascular disease. Your elevated ALT/SGPT level may indicate that you have some liver damage or inflammation. Your elevated creatinine level may indicate that you have some kidney damage or dysfunction. Your elevated albumin levels may indicate that you have some kidney damage or dysfunction, or that you are dehydrated. 

It is important to discuss these results with your doctor to determine the cause of the elevated levels and to determine the best course of action. input: Hello doctor,You were wonderful in allaying some health anxiety over some skin issues several months ago. So, I thought I would consult with you on another question pertaining to my son. My son is 19 years old and has no diagnosed medical issues. I noticed back when he was about eight or ten years old that he had a mark resembling a cafe au lait mark on his back, in the upper shoulder area. I had always asked the pediatrician to look at it during his yearly physicals, and they made nothing of it. Throughout the years it has grown a bit and has become darker and more rough in texture. It is probably slightly less than an inch in length and looks like a few small lesions grouped together. Again, I have brought it to the pediatrician\s attention and he was not concerned. Three months ago, I made an appointment for him and my other son with a dermatologist for a skin exam, and I pointed out the spots which I wanted to be checked in particular. We met with the physician\s assistant there, and my younger son had a peculiar spot I pointed out, of which the PA conducted a shave biopsy, which came back as a mildly atypical junctional nevus. For my older son, I pointed out the spot on his back/shoulder, and the PA diagnosed it as a linear epidermal nevus. She said the chances of it becoming dangerous are slim to none. It may darken throughout the years, and they will simply monitor it at yearly visits. Unfortunately, I went on to research online about epidermal nevi and of course I ran into information showing a possible link to epidermal nevus syndrome and all of its associated neurological and skeletal defects. As I said, he is 19 and has no medical issues, is extremely intelligent, etc. In your opinion, is it safe to say that I should not be concerned about those syndromes? I presume it is primarily related to the numerous and systemic epidermal nevi, which he does not have, and I would think it would have presented by now? And my last even more neurotic question. My online research led me to some information saying that a certain type of epidermal nevus could be related to a gene mutation that could be passed along to an offspring, with them having possible serious skin scaling conditions, etc. Again, he has just one solitary small epidermal nevus. No biopsy was done, as the PA did not feel it was necessary. Do you feel there is any need for me to worry about that potential genetic mutation? Thank you so much for reading my long query.
output: It is highly unlikely that your son has any genetic mutation related to his epidermal nevus. Epidermal nevi are usually benign and do not cause any serious health issues. The chances of it becoming dangerous are slim to none, and it is unlikely that it will cause any serious health issues in the future. It is also unlikely that it will be passed on to any offspring. Therefore, it is safe to say that you should not be concerned about any syndromes or genetic mutations related to the epidermal nevus.

input: Hello doctor,Every night around 2-3 AM, any thought that crosses my mind makes me overthink about it. I am worried about such things that do not have a fixed solution. It is also important to address the anxiety that is causing you to overthink. Cognitive Behavioral Therapy (CBT) is an effective treatment for anxiety and can help you to identify and challenge the thoughts that are causing you to overthink. Additionally, relaxation techniques such as deep breathing, progressive muscle relaxation, and mindfulness can help to reduce anxiety and promote better sleep. 

Finally, it is important to avoid smoking as it can have a negative impact on your health. If you are struggling with anxiety, it is important to talk to a mental health professional who can help you to develop healthy coping strategies.
